YJHiJsqp288l8SoyUabAQA.text: Texas de Brazil is amazing your first time then kind of just plateaus at really good to good. Nothing will beat the first time you eat here, it's like nothing you've ever seen before. Endless meat, a decent salad bar and oh yeah did I mention endless meat?  The taste of meat is inconsistent. For example we went last night and the meat was medium rare and tasted amazing. The time before the meat was more well done and extremely salty. I personally prefer the medium rare and less salt. They do allow you to choose the desired temperature and will bring it out to you separately.   At $45/ plate it seems fair. They are very attentive to your needs and almost swarm you with all varieties of meat during your entire dining experience which is exactly what you want at a place like this. I recommend getting on the mailing list for deals and specials, that is usually the only time I will go because it will make a good experience great when you know you are only paying half price!

I8PK1-qqjpJ-Hrn13TFgdQ.text: Excellent service and phenomenal food!  This is a great dining experience all around!

YbLP-AVVhgEzz_7f7vF1Qw.text: Do not waste your time going here!! This is as Brazilian as Olive Garden is Italian!! NOT! The waiters ( I won't dare say Gauchos) were walking around with skewers of meat not knowing where to go!!! Many of them Passing our table when we clearing had our disc side up that we wanted food... When the meat finally started coming out there wasn't much to choose from. Oh and the $25.00 coupon offered if you sign up for alerts doesn't come until after you've been there. Asked the waitress if she could take off the $25,00 and she said they needed the code from the email.  When I got the email there was no code. .  Texas de BraZil does Not compare to Fogo by any means.  If you want a good steak in Pittsburgh go to Hyde Park!!    If you are ever in Philly and want impeccable food and service visit Fogo de chao!!! You won't be disappointed!!

y5SqR5efIJYSGLD2GbsS4g.text: Listen to other reviews!! The meats are salted the the point of being inedible, and this is coming from a salt lover. This is not limited to one single cut. All 15 or so meats seemed equality destroyed with salt. I'm not sure if this is a tactic to reduce peoples consumption but I've been to other high end Brazil BBQ style restaurants and will NEVER return to this location.  That being said the quality of food and cooking was very good and I was left disappointed to be forced to eat sushi from a salad bar for dinner. The entire party of 6 were equally disappointed. We left feeling slightly robbed after the high cost per plate...

VHq4KT88QqslxYHmDmmKoQ.text: First time at a Brazilian steak house, but the friend in our party of 4 said it was just as good as one he raved about in Montreal.   Know thy self before going into this fantastic spot.   If you want to go the salad/food bar route with an amazing selection of dressings, prosciutto, cheeses, lobster bisque, California rolls and so on...due so without shame. Not everyday should be one where you tackle mountains of endless meat.   If you do possess the fortitude to go full Monty on the full dinner...Godspeed. Rule #1: skip the sausage. This may feel dirty and normally I'd agree. However, every sausage you turn your back on leaves more opportunity for filet, bacon-wrapped filet, flank, lamb chop, rack of lamb, a countless collection of other meats and those little cheese filled table rolls.   Either decision will pay dividends. Choose wisely.  *Amendment* I was encouraged to tell the REAL story about my experience at Texas De Brazil. Please don't continue if you are sensitive to graphic imagery.  I'm ashamed to say this was my first time at a Brazilian Steakhouse. I was so over-whelmed by the constant temptation of filet, bacon wrapped filet, more filet, top siloin...O! there's the filet again!   *I'm warning you...this is where it gets weird*  As my party and I exited Texas De Brazil and made our way toward the parking deck I could feel the pressure building. My pace quickened. My knowledge of the interior lobby of the Sheraton I was walking toward was my salvation. As I began to run I turned to my friends and yelled "SHERATON!" assuming they could piece together the immediacy of my situation.   *Seriously. Last chance.*  The order of events once hurriedly inside of the hotel restroom went as such: -Seat cover -Sit -Wipe -Flush -Turn -Vomit -Flush -Turn back around to sit again -Flush  I had eaten so much meat that I nearly exploded. That being said...can't wait to go back.

wx7xnqAN3p-aWXa2sCyIXA.text: I have to say this is the only place which impressed to the highest level when I first went there, very unique way of serving food and different from Pittsburgh style!  we have become a fan and after the first time we have been 5 or 6 times and everything is always very impressive!  But there is some things that could be improved and what I noticed is when you go there past 7 you won't get too many choices of meat and most of your meat will be a little burned and even fired bananas and mashed potatoes looked like they were left overs.  every time you go for 2 people you will end up spending a little over 100$ for sure and when you do that you want decent food on the table!  overall, I took my friends there, I always recommend people to go there, we love it!

cCEoamTanM-qSUr3DwbHVg.text: Food was delicious as always.  Cocktail not made well this time.  We went for the special lunchtime opening on Dec 18th for $24.99 but we were charged $44.99.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Advertisement said $24.99 but we were charged $44.99

04W0K3iRbyucRX78jRIqoQ.text: Fantastic! Go hungry!!! The a flank steak was perfect. Sushi on the salad bar. Service was perfect.

nq_k2PoUfT_KYnun7BP_UA.text: Not the best tasting meat. Too salty. Definetely a fun experience with co workers, but being a fogo de chao obsessor, it was hard for me to completely enjoy this meal. It was $50 a person, so come very hungry that's for sure! By meh for me, probably won't be back

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best goat cheese!

wvF3xgODP8GyW0d2izlBbw.text: Absolutely my favorite meal that Pittsburgh has to offer.  Everything they cook (haven't tried the lamb)  is absolutely amazing.   I typically won't eat flank steak but tried it as recommended by one of my servers and it was ridiculously amazing.  I will say that drinks are a little expensive here,  more so than other high end restaurants downtown but I'm not taking a star away bc I love it here and love this place and would eat here every day if I could.

vs2GdtGxK5QpgyloH4F_9g.text: Kay and I made reservations months in advance for our 4 year anniversary dinner at Texas De Brazil and were not let down by any means. In fact, having only seen churrascarias on television beforehand, my expectations of a grand feast were not only met but exceeded from the beginning of our meal until closure. The term "epic" may be overused these days, but it most certainly deserves to be affixed to this astonishing South American churrascaria located in Pittsburgh's Station Square. As you enter, you're whisked to your table by hosts that almost move like dancers, the staff at TDB performing like it's opening night for a show on Broadway, and the critics are in the first row. A vast salad bar is yours for the taking... youtube.com/watch?v=3uts... You'll find... Sushi Salads with myriad dressings. One of the most chunky and kingly potato salads ever crafted, its mayonnaise dressing elegant and simple, its flavors extravagant. Grilled asparagus. Hearts of Palm Fresh Mozzarella. Smoked salmon. Need I go on? One trip alone will do a glutton in, and yes, this is an odyssey of gluttony made respectable. There's so much to sample that one can easily neglect the steakhouse portion of the meal (a much less expensive salad bar-only reservation package is available for the timid and/or frugal), but that would be a tragedy. Men in vaguely ancient, martial attire wield long, imposing, sword-like knives and staves that carry on them exquisitely glistening, unending specimens of meat, all of it seemingly medium-rare, every morsel serving as a reminder that the carnivorous is at heart, purely carnal. Leg of Lamb, bacon-wrapped chicken breasts, filet mignon, naturally-cased sausages that pop when bitten into, parmesan-coated pork loins, flank steak, alcatra, picanha, braised beef ribs, obscene amounts of sirloin...I was overwhelmed, forcing myself to flip the green card over to red to stop the glorious onslaught of prime protein, all of it shaved from the metal spits in mouthwatering, sublimely seasoned flaps that contained ideal amounts of flavorsome fat. I wanted to try everything. Everything! youtube.com/watch?v=lYFG... I'd become so intoxicated by the food, I'd forget what I'd already tried. Plate upon plate of their pao de queijo (cheese bread) threatened to fill my stomach beyond capacity, the tiny, chewy balls of dough and parmesan proving addictive, irresistible. Mounds of perfectly fluffy, buttery garlic mashed potatoes nearly did the same as did the egregiously scrumptious, syrupy, sugar-coated sweet fried bananas which almost made dessert unnecessary...but dessert is always necessary... youtube.com/watch?v=Q4xT... Coconut Chess Pie, Chocolate Mousse Cake, and Pecan Pie were all shared by us both. Yes, we ordered 3 desserts, going far out of bounds. We had become extremists. When would enough be enough??? The chess pie and mousse were each full of angelic, saccharine cream while the pecan pie brought us down to earth with its molasses, shoofly mouthfeel and nutty essence. Our exorbitant bill (smack!) reflected our exorbitant appetites. We felt as if we'd been led astray by Hunter S.Thompson for a lost weekend only for him to kick us out of his limousine, abandoning us on a roadside, never to speak to us again. Yet we were without regret. Dinner at Texas De Brazil is an evening of sheer indulgence not for those whose will is strong. To show restraint here is to be cheated out of something juicy, rich, savory, sweet, unforgettable. You are meant to eat everything you see and everything you shouldn't. You are meant to go home in a near-coma after attempting to stagger out of the dining room under your own power. Cast your inhibitions aside and have the meal of your life with that person most central to your life. P.S. The service provided by everyone in the house from front to back was the absolute tops. The entire crew went out of their way to ensure that we left undoubtedly satisfied, and we were undoubtedly satisfied times 3.

RUt73uoi8MUOpMCO8jlPkg.text: The food is amazing, the service is TERRIBLE. I have no problem paying $50+ per person, but when I am paying for a meal that costs hundreds of dollars I expect to be treated with common courtesy.  To be completely honest, I have received better service from MCDONALDS than I have from Texas De Brazil. Nearly every waitress at Texas De Brazil walks around with a chip on her shoulder and gives everyone at the table an attitude.  The last two times I went to this restaurant we had to deal with a snotty and rude wait staff that ruined the meal for everyone at the table.  There was one evening where myself and 5 others arrived about 30 minutes before closing and had the rudest, least attentive waitress I have ever encountered in any establishment. Ever. Not exaggerating at all. She gave us attitude the whole time, didn't smile, didn't ask how anyone was doing, and looked ticked off, miserable, and pissed/annoyed at us the whole time. She didn't notice, or care, when we were missing a place setting and needed more silverware. She made us all feel very uncomfortable and unwelcome. We asked her for a rare cut of meat to be delivered to the table and she gave us attitude about that and made it seem like it was a huge problem. We should have gotten up and left right then.  At the end of the meal we asked for dessert, and once again, received an enormous amount of attitude. I think she was the snottiest at that point, and after she took the dessert order we had had enough of being treated like shit and took the dessert in to-go boxes. I completely regretted going out to dine that evening.  We hoped that that treatment was us catching them on a bad night, and decided to give them one more try...  The last time I went to the restaurant I had made reservations for a large party of 40 people. The majority of the people in our party are professional tattoo artists, many of which have been featured on national and international television numerous times. We all came to the restaurant directly from a tattoo convention in Pittsburgh, and due to this, half of our party ended up arriving later than our reservation time.  I checked in with the hostess at 7PM along with 5-6 others and she directed us to wait at the bar. About 30-45 minutes later I received a call on my cell phone from the hostess, asking me where my party was and if we were still going to make it to dinner. Um, didn't I check in with her already? Did she forget? She smoking some mary jane?  While we were waiting at the bar, this pillow faced woman (who also has an attitude) approached me and curtly asked how everyone would be paying and then, after giving us a really fake attempt at a smile, immediately left. She didn't even attempt to be courteous, didn't ask how we were doing. Wow.  I had to leave the meal before everyone else due to not feeling well, so I got up and tracked down our waitress to ask her to pay for my bill and two others. Apparently this was a huge problem for her, and she asked me, "How many glasses of wine did your friend have? Did she pay at the bar or at the table? She ordered a creme brulee right?" ISN'T THAT THE WAIT STAFF'S JOB TO KEEP TRACK OF THE ORDER? That is NOT my responsibility lady, that is YOURS.  I was trying to talk to her about the bill and she rudely walked away from me in the middle of the conversation! I couldn't believe it! I had to chase her down AGAIN to have her take care of the bill. How utterly and unbelievably RUDE.  The worst part of the entire evening? I later found out that they DOUBLE CHARGED THE TAB ON MY FRIEND. Yes, that's right. I PAID FOR HER ENTIRE TAB, AND THEY DELIVERED THE SAME BILL AFTER I LEFT, BILLING US TWICE FOR THE SAME MEAL. Unbelievable.  The hiring manager at Texas De Brazil needs to get his head out of his ass and fire the rude and inattentive wait staff.  I have worked in the hospitality industry for years as a busser, hostess, and waitress, and I would NEVER have treated my patrons as badly as I was treated by these jerks. I am so appalled at the service I received at Texas De Brazil that I will never return. I don't care how good the food is - I refuse to PAY to be treated like shit.

5w6YjSdoIdIn5Dk2syX1Aw.text: Disappointing! I have been to several Brazilian steakhouses before and this by far is the worst. The food (although I can't judge too much of the food since they only brought us filet, and flank steak over and over again!)and the service were horrible.  We had reservations and arrived early. The restaurant was half empty but we still had to wait 1 hour to be seated, as the rude hostess stated " We will not seat you before your reservation time"..really?! There were plenty of empty tables!  Once we finally sat down, all they brought over was fillet and flank steak over , and over, and over, again. No lamb, no chicken, no pork, none of their"signature meats". Definitely not worth it...there are plenty other restaurants of this type to try.

sJpB3witUzhkUMgdRqqq1A.text: I usually don't give bad reviews, but my experience last night at this establishment was SO bad, that I had to find my rusty Yelp account to share my horrendous experience at this Texas de Brazil.  TL/DR: Waited too long to get subpar, inconsistent food. Terrible Service. Wasted 2.5 hours. They can't manage the place when big groups show up. Just hope that there are no big groups when you go in to dine.

0pZglpcEhbB40IA09kro-w.text: Delicious. A bit pricey but they do offer a military discount for which I was grateful that could be applied to my whole table. The area is also really nice to take a stroll after such a big meal.

zhyygAgxFqgqJOLjEJd8zQ.text: After being back multiple times since first trip, it is still good just not as good as first experience.  It is very inconsistent, which isn't a good quality to have for such an expensive meal.   The bad:  One experience, the beef ribs were cold in the middle, but somehow still cooked.  I think they were just reheated from the night before.  Also, the steaks are unevenly cooked, not a huge problem for me but some people might have a probably with the fillets sometimes being med. rare and other times med well.  Finally, not a fault of the gaucho per se, but he flipped my spoon out of the bowl and on the table splattering soup.  This occurred as the manager was walking up to see how the meal was going.  The act was an accident, but then the manager didn't even get anyone to come clean it up, I had to ask the waiter.  The good:  The service.  Overall, our waiters have been fantastic.  One time a waiter was average, but I think that might just be compared to the others we have.  The food, yes it might be inconsistent, but overall really good.

m6F4QH-fkUtaX4tEQWiqvw.text: I'm a carnivore.  Meat is the staple to my diet.  Please note that I only ate the rodizo array of meat.  The service was good, sangria delicious and the lamb dishes were prepared the best.  Some of the dishes were either too salty or bland.  Compared to my experience with the Texas De Brazil in Nevada, I'm not impressed, hence the "A-Ok" review.  If you are a big meat eater and carnivore like me, I'd give this is shot for you will have your chicken, lamb, beef and pork.  If you are not a big meat eater, I'd opt for a different establishment with more variety.

r85_P_RsQDzFE0QqmzjmiA.text: Too. Much. Meat.  I'm a meat person. I'll pick that over pasta any day, but this is waaaaaay too much. I guess you know that going into it. Very salty! Overpriced for what you can honestly consume. I was not well for days. A friend just did the salad bar option and even that with a drink was a crazy bill.  Service was good so I guess that's a plus.

ojLPCBnvlgEPP8hzna5fqw.text: My first time at Texas de Brazil and I must say that I was impressed. I have been to 3 different Brazilian steakhouses and this one is the second best. Beautiful ambiance, ample seating, lovely decor. The seating is a bit close together. Doesn't make it too comfy for a 7 month pregnant woman :) On this particular day, service was slow. Our waiter was very kind and checked on us, but he was slow in bringing drinks and we had to ask for any refills that we wanted. The salad bars was one of the nicest that I've seen compared to the other Brazilian steakhouses that I've been to. Great selection. I can't wait to return!

fM8uhc55iPH02HTtyyXyEQ.text: I have always wanted to go here but I haven't been able to find somebody to go. Today I went with my son. The meat was amazing and all the servers made sure to accommodate that I prefer medium Well to Well Done meat. The cheese balls as appetizers were good. The salad bar was fresh really like the prosciutto and the bread. The fried sugary bananas where amazing. I finalize my meal with a creme brulee even though the server said it wasn't their best it was really good.

4X6WC1-_5YUWb68LKdmHow.text: My family and I showed up with a party of (7). Our waiter was extremely good. The meat part was excellent and our waiter did a great job asking us if we got want we wanted and if there was anything specific we wanted.   We got (2) of the Cabernet which was good and reasonably priced.   The salad bar I thought was lacking a little but I didn't come for that.   The dessert was great. We got (4) different types to share.   The experience was great. We were there for (3) hours and no complaints. I went home full and happy.

8mxWPmxaz96IwFOyGPDgSQ.text: So expensive. An hour wait with 21 open tables. If you're looking to gorge yourself this might be your place. If you're looking for a good meal at an appropriate price this isn't it.

zQURWANKs1nwbopPv0yTUw.text: I went here on restaurant week and it was 35.18 per person plus tax and service. And I think it really was it because there are so much fooooood!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

uGMrTK_i2FAz-cGJqwEpbg.text: Wow! Made a reservation on OpenTable for 6 people at 7pm. We arrived 20 minutes early and India the hostess graciously seated the first half of us. Alexander our waiter arrived, took our drink order and waited for the others. Alexander explained the drink menu, dinner options and salad bar. The salad bar was great! In spite of other reviews, the salad bar had pewter looking name plates for all dishes, not paper tabs from a deli counter.  The Gauchos were more than attentive with the meat-and more than friendly to explain the cut,style and seasoning.  The manager made his rounds and ensured we were properly fed and satisfied!  I would give it 10 stars if possible!!!!

xi3cLnC5MzNvUiPPz78RXg.text: Writing a review of this place just because my service tonight was so spot on! We sat in the bar area, and our waitress had to work the tables, bar, and outside seating, and she was still super attentive and was always available when we needed something ! She (I think her name was Alexis) knew the gluten free and non-gluten free food items and had great drink recommendations. The staff with the meat selections was super friendly and the choices came out in a timely manner. The restaurant had a promotion tonight so the price was great, and even with them being very busy the service was perfect! Well done!

3egkvwqqdEH7jr-63ucVSw.text: I think that any negative review has not dined at a Brazilian Steakhouse previously.   Yes, the meat is salty in most cases- that's how it's supposed to be. It's cooked in rock salt.  Yes, the meat comes quickly if you have your chip on "green". You are informed of that upon sitting, and encouraged to take your time.  Last night we had an excellent experience at Texas de Brazil. I was impressed by the choices on the salad bar- and had to fight myself not to eat all of it so I would have room for all 'da meats!!  Our server, Alex, was phenomenal and added to a really nice night. He was knowledgable about the two signature drinks we had and even met me at the salad bar to make sure everything was going well.  It was a packed house on a Friday night, but a manager stopped by to make sure everything was up to par. Good gesture.   This is what you would consider a "dining experience". I can understand how some would call it rushed (if the chip is green, I never felt rushed otherwise) or salty, but that's part of this Brazilian ambience. Take it or leave it.  It's a little pricey, but I don't consider it over priced. We had two dinners, four drinks (total), and dessert and it was about $140. I've spent WAY more than that at other steakhouses. We were there for a special occasion, so I didn't mind paying extra.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brazilian cheesecake- but all of the desserts looked great!
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Signature coconut drink with some garlic mash in the background!

06PIEXdUysb7jtMW9IMaqQ.text: First time there and it lived up to the recommendations. Zack was fantastic and made sure we were taken care. Can't wait to go back!

rdPRdv58VWqtW2tIe2nI8Q.text: We went here for Valentine's Day and it was great. Friendly staff, amazing service, and delicious food. We had reservations and were seated right away. Salad bar had a large variety of food - lobster bisque was delicious but limit yourself or you'll get full on the steak, lamb, and chicken fast! The meal also comes with bread, mashed potatoes, and banana (dessert?). I would definitely come back

cNwWr2I80Zd48mqgkyE5jA.text: This was my first time going to this restaurant.  They were late in getting our table ready and there was really no place where we could wait.  Being a large open room meant that it was quite noisy.  There was a nice variety of food at the buffet, and it was quite enjoyable.  The meat is seethe by carvers who roam around the dining room.  To me, the flank steak was the best of what they offered us.  Some of the other beef was overcooked ( for me).  We had to repeatedly request pork, and when we finally got some, it was disappointing in that it was rather dry. The food is plentiful, so you should be hungry if you go.

LWvWIZCoQBFd65T9EyIivA.text: My fiance and I attended dinner here last night and it was simply amazing! We called ahead to make reservations and were promptly/cheerfully greeted and seated. The server explained to us how everything worked and sent us over to the 50 item salad bar. It's definitely a salad bar but really so much more! They've got so many different fresh cheese and cold/warm salads to choose from.  After we finished the salad portion, they brought over the fried plantains which was explained to be the palate cleanser between meats (it really did work, so I definitely recommend utilizing this- they will bring more if you run out!) When you flip your card to green, the men carrying around the meat will stop at your table and carve you off a slice. Flip your card to red and they stop doing it until you're ready to keep eating.   We also had the red sangria, which was good (huge pitcher) but I'm not sure if it's something we'd do again because it added $40 to our bill and wasn't as extravagant as the rest of the meal.   We finished with a slice of Brazilian Cheese Cake and their Chocolate Ganache cake - which as a professional baker, this was arguably the most important part to me... and it knocked our socks off! I would 10 out of 10 highly recommend! Just make sure you're ready to treat yourself as our total bill come out to $155 before tip.

t_vA_h-Nf9boLI5D2vgVpA.text: Was here on Saturday with my girlfriend. These style of restaurants are a little pricey, but worth it. They come by every few minutes with a cut of meat for you to eat, and each cut is cooked to perfection. The salad bar was also amazing, especially the sushi and lobster bisque. The dessert than totally drove it home.   The server, Luis, was very friendly and earned a 20% tip. I also like how attentive the management was. Gentlemen in suits and ties came by every few minutes to make sure we enjoyed our time.  I highly recommend this place and it's now another reason I like coming back home to Pittsburgh.  Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Il6LV23_ItIBbZLUDPSBLQ.text: I usually write very poetic, inspirational, and beautifully crafted reviews for everyone to read.(if you don't believe me check them out!) But in the case of this place I can't make any promises ... If you've ever seen me you'd know I'm no regular at salad bars. But this salad bar gets an A+++ in my book! I visited it so many times I had to start turning meat down! And I never do that!! (no homo) Speaking of meat, we had filet mignon, lamb, bacon wrapped chicken, and many others. All beautifully prepared!! I can't wait to visit again and shove all that beautiful meat in my mouth..(again no homo) if you've never been here you need to visit at least once. And if you're a True carnivore like me, you'll be back. Again and again and again...

53gtuNmJ03wICnUu4oFHAQ.text: Texas de Brazil is a little different from what I'm use to of a restaurant the host & servers seem pretty rush which might be why it seemed not that inviting but the different meats that they offer is amazing everything just melts in your mouth the salad bar has a huge variety also and is not a usual salad bar I do recommend getting water though because the meal is very pricey but it's worth it overall. We did have a few people come out to us who was cutting the meats which were extremely friendly and inviting. Also remember the green part of the card means FEED ME MORE & the red means LET ME DIGEST haha. Deserts are also extra!

v9XQUjGc9UZy_cZsEaORhw.text: It was delicious and amazingly good! worth the price for how much meat you can eat! Went here for my birthday dinner and just on random days due to how amazing it truly is

Iqdn4XIWfAgoKWum5CDXVQ.text: It was an awesome experience! Getting the chance to try out all sort of delicious meat.  They also had a very interesting salad bar and a delicious dessert.  I am definitely coming again!

qUOgJoKg164q5fqSRxa9gQ.text: Meat metropolis, carnivorous conundrum, however I describe it you'll still have to experience it to understand it for yourself.  If my visit to Tin Front Cafe was my earth friendly food decision (see my review of them, awesome place) then this was my f*ck all the animals food decision.  Did I feel bad?  When you taste the marinated, sea salt infused lamb chop you might not feel bad either, but let's not get ahead of ourselves cause surprisingly there's more than MEATS the eye here.  Located in Station Square in Pittsburgh PA this protein playground is surprisingly low key and you'd drive right past thinking it wasn't much.  As soon as you walk through the front door though, you realize you've walked into the belly of the meat beast.  I couldn't help but admire that everyone in the place was happy and not a seat was empty.  While we waited me and my other 5 friends made our way to the bar.  I had the signature drink the Caipirinha (meaning little peasant) a Brazilian drink along the lines of a Mojito but a little more sweet than minty.  At $9 it was a small drink but that's to be expected at a place like this.  I will say I think it was great, and worth a try at least once.  Our table was finally ready.  We had the option of heading to the large and impressively fresh salad bar before we began our meatscapade and there's way more than lettuce on there.  Sushi, lobster bisque, potatos, fresh pastrami and hunks of cheese and bread and crackers populate it.  For $25 you can get just that and you could have a pretty good meal with just that, but that's not why you came.  After a sample of the salad bar the main course got underway.    They give you a small circle card that is red on one side and green on the other.  Green means go, red means please stop I'm so full I'm gonna explode.  Makes sense? Good lets eat meat.  Try a tablespoon of mashed potatoes and maybe one roll but save all the room for various cuts of seasoned beef, lamb, pork, chicken, and brazilian sausage cut fresh straight to your plate.  The lamb chops and the parmesan encrusted pork stood out to me.  All the steaks were flawless and can be cooked however you like them.  The sausage was smokey and delicious and the chicken melted right off the bone.  Make it a mission of yours to eat every meat at least once.  They can carve off just a sliver or a huge slice so you can portion your sampling out based on your stomach size.  They give you these sugar and cinnamon fried bananas to cleanse your pallet between meats and I ate essentially a whole bundle of bananas as part of my meal in memory of Haramba and because they are f*cking delicious.    At $45 a person some people think this is a bit pricey ($70 after a drink and a tip/per person) but you could easily eat $100 in meat and with that being said, it's pricey but for good reason.  It's not cheap and it only borders expensive for what you get.  This isn't something you would probably do every weekend but every 3 months I could see myself treating myself to this meat masquerade.  I waited a year to go and I can safely say it was worth the wait and actually made me wish I went sooner.    Go with a group for a special trip, this is a great place to watch each member of your party slowly tap out and turn their cards to red.    apreciar! (Portuguese for Enjoy!)

dcbuWtCckBasInBNuPNVxw.text: Texas de Brazil is a slightly above average Brazilian steakhouse. The meats are fantastic as they should be and the gauchos are all over it! The bar's options are a little light on the truly Brazilian accompaniments (sushi is not a typical Brazilian steakhouse side). The server was fantastic and the manager checked on all of the tables during their visits which is always pleasant (as long as it's genuine which his was). They only fair warning and I don't know if it was just an off thing, the floors were SUPER SLICK so if you're toting around in 4.5" stilettos like I was - be careful. I didn't go down but I was walking like an idiot just so I wouldn't.  We will probably be back because you can never get enough picanha!

3kbGKxE0Dtk8FaiPpYTJ8g.text: Location: Nestled in Station Square beside Sheraton. Great spot for catching the Gateway Clipper/Segway/Ducky Tours  Facility: Friendly Hostess and asked if we had dined here before to which we answered no. We were seated with a smile.  Explained the salad bar and meat options to us. You serve yourself at the salad bar and the options are plentiful if you don't eat meat. Then gauchos (Brazil Cowboys) come around with large meat cuts cooked at medium rare on skewers to cut off and serve as much as you like.  They also have a large bar area with good bottle selection. The facility is large and could easily accommodate a huge party at a moments notice with everyone starting to eat in under 5min.  My Experience: Stephanie walked us through the menu and cocktail list. Our server Rich was top notch, funny, professional and on point. Last, Slade (I believe) stopped by and shared his experience and growth inside of the restaurant giving it a family feel counter to most corporate restaurants.  In Conclusion: A must do for a large party or a very hungry couple that may be on a time constraint and wants a quick wholesome meal and excellent service from the whole team.

MFkq2E5pAFIA-FYllqKGMA.text: Are here for restaurant week so it was a great deal, $35 for dinner including dessert. I think the key is to know a bit of what you want before going in, otherwise you'll get full too fast! The salad bar is good but not amazing so I would save room for the meat. My fav was the flank steak, super juicy and flavorful. The filet mignon medallions was cooked well and very tender. My boyfriend loved the lamb chops and the leg of lamb. We skipped trying any chicken or pork, so I can't comment on those. If there are particular meats you like, you can let your server know and they will make sure it comes to you table.   Drinks were good, the caipirinha was delicious - closest to a shaken margarita. And the key lime pie after was delicious! The only negative is sometimes there was significant wait before meats circulated, especially if they run out before getting to your table and you have to wait for the next batch. I'll probably be back again for lunch since it's cheaper, or for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Key lime pie

O9wThpz1wvsb4raJNa3VqA.text: Ok we took one star due to meats seasoning. Yes they tell you about use of salt but every single piece is to salty. People with hypertension and CHF needs to stay away from here. Also 15 before we left it was when we saw some cuts of meats advertised but not served until we were done eating. No ribs at all. Josh was excellent with service.  Outstanding salad bar.

3LjwRatCObek1f9eSWR-zA.text: This was my first time a the Pittsburgh location.  I have mixed feelings compared to my visits to the Ft Worth, TX location.  The food was good, the service was average with a "rushed" feel.  The location is all open inside and pretty loud.  They were very busy when we visited on a Saturday evening.  We had reservations, but still had to wait for a table.  That is a little annoying to me.  This place really noisy and in my opinion has too many tables crammed in.  The wine I had ordered wasn't available.  The server did not know anything about wine or drinks.  Seemed like college kids working at the place.  You could see that the servers were rushing everywhere.  There were not as many people serving meats as the Ft Worth, TX location.  There were kids all over the place and at the salad bar eating right off it with no staff doing much about the situation.  Mostly parents to blame on that deal, but also part managing staff as well.  Overall ok experience, but was not what I was expecting from previous visits to other locations.  You can wear jeans and a tee-shirt here and be just fine.  I will go back, but I'm not in a rush to visit the place again.

ipn632Eso680Wci1i0gEHg.text: The service was excellent! The food was delicious! The salad bar was clean and inviting. We will certainly return for another special occasion meal.

aGDBiVM6sQxBu82wGCgu3Q.text: I have been to Texas de Brazil numerous times and to various locations. My family and I fell in love with the restaurant at it's Aruba location. Simply awesome experience. However, the experience in Pittsburgh has been quite different. This first visit to the station square location was good - busy Friday night, pretty speedy service. Yesterday my family and I went to celebrate a birthday and it was a Sunday. We had reservations but still had to wait 20 minutes to be seated in a fairly empty dining room. Once sat, our waiter was nice and helpful and served us accordingly. The biggest problem with our dinner were the gauchos! We sat with empty plates (and bellies) waiting for them to stop by with a delicious skewer of meat. We were either passed by or they all went to a party of ten and were instantly cleaned out. It was pretty annoying considering the price of the place. I said something to our waiter and it helped...a little. Maybe the point in all of this is just not to go on Sundays.

KTbdOuxMhAm0j4NpwyoAow.text: Having experienced TDB in Aruba and then again in Orlando...the states still haven't met the standards of the Happy Island of Aruba when it comes to this steakhouse.  With that said, the Pittsburgh location was hands down a better atmosphere than the Orlando restaurant, and the food was great.  If you've never been to another one, the salad bar is fantastic.  If you've been to the TDB in Aruba...it's a little lacking.  I will say that no one really goes to a Brazilian steakhouse for salad...and the meat was excellent.  Even better than the food was our server, who was incredibly knowledgeable about the authentic Brazilian cocktails, the seasonings on the meats, and very attentive to our table.  This would be a great spot for a business dinner, any celebration, and the start to any guys-night-out/bachelor party etc.  It's a meat fest for sure, and I recommend fasting for at least 8 hours so you truly get your monies worth.

pQBCSh3hBB4BWhaCGGVJMg.text: Very expensive restaurant. They charge $45 a person just for the food. Drinks are very good.They bring you plantains to the table but they are extremely sweet. I think they put sugar on it. The service is good but we felt a little rush. Waitress keep coming back asking "everything ok? Need more drinks? Need a clean plate? Are you done eating meat? Ready for dessert? We were in and out in 1 hour. Maybe they want people to eat fast and leave.

zkmpnD83Wj8BBdGSsdGgpw.text: Great service, tasty food.  I'm glad we finally got a good Brazilian steak house in Pittsburgh!  I've been to the other two in PGH and the food and service do not come close to comparing.  I've been to Fogo De Chao (multiple cities), Chima, and a few other Brazilian Steakhouse as I travel the county for my job and this is right up there with them in food quality and service.  I'm not sure what the other reviewers are saying about the bad service, but the service here was awesome.  They were fast and dealt extremely well with getting the meat we wanted as well as cooked to the right temperature for various likings at our table.  Simply put....I'll be back.  Can't say the same for the greenforest cafe or the palms.   btw...my wife is originally from Brazil and I've eaten at Churrascaria in Sao Paulo and Rio in addition to all the chains here in the USA, so I can confidently say this is definitely one of the better ones!

oNE6tF1UYtIXBQFc2CzCPw.text: We were sat in a too small table that was in the middle of a main isle. It felt like the table was just placed there to make more room. As soon as we were shown our table we immediately asked for another table and were told by the hostess that all the 4 tops surrounding us had reservations for 4 coming and and they couldn't place us anywhere else. We should have just left because that was just the beginning of a let down night. With a table as such, every tom dick and harry was buzzing by our table from both sides and we constantly felt the breeze and it always felt like someone was going to bump into us. It wasn't relaxing to say the least. The table was so small, i could not even place my purse anywhere, even hanging from my knee so eventually just ate with it in my lap. The most disappointing part of this dinner was that all the tables that were empty when we came in were all eventually filled with couples of 2 dining. After the third couple was seated at a bigger table I said something to our waitress. She apologized but said she couldn't do anything. The food was good albeit everything was a little too rare for me and we had to wait longer for meats that were medium. We had a super tough time trying to get our bill and we asked the manager twice to see if he could get it for us, which he did get the second time...that is actually understandable as they were very busy. I think the lies and bad seating has me convinced not to go back though. At 50.00 a head to start with, I can get a much better atmosphere than feeling like im going to get knocked off my chair by passerbyers/meat servers every 60 seconds

KI43Jq7Y2jXAHOdpTH6nOg.text: Very disappointing,  On a recent trip to Pittsburg decided to give it a try.  We  waiting an hour to be seated (arrived at 8 not seated until 9) even though the restaurant was half empty,  We were expecting different types of meat  (lamb, beef, chicken etc.)as has been our experience at other Brazilian steakhouses.  All we received was filet and filet with bacon, no other cuts of beef or any other meats!  What!  I thought we were to be served other meats.  Not worth the money we spent.  After speaking with the manager all he kept saying was "the good thing is you are still in the restaurant", but no change in meats..  If I wanted just filet, I would have gone to an American steakhouse and not pay $50/per person.

4QPKZGqWV75HhixroPEIVA.text: Really good but way too much food.  I felt full even the next day which is not normal for me at all, I am always hungry.  You may think you have to like beef to go here well I don't and liked it anyway.  There is a big salad bar with all kinds of good things and there are plenty of other kinds of meat that they bring around to your table including chicken, pork, and lamb.  I really liked the Parmesan pork!

mbrwqDY-f0umrKkgA3pXhA.text: I can't think of anything to say, other than "wow". This place is amazing. I highly recommend a reservation, at least on the weekend, as the restaurant was very busy. We had a reservation and showed up early for drinks. We checked in with hostess and saddled up to bar. The service at bar and for dinner was amazing. The potatoes au gratin were amazing, as was everything at the buffet. The meats were cooked perfectly and beyond delicious. This is a great place for a date, a celebration, or just a nice dinner.

MCQQ9tMMH0npFRzWMFUZYw.text: AMAIZING FOOD! Went there for Easter with my extremely picky family.  There was something for everyone!   The salad area was remarkably fresh and had everything from cheeses, soups, sushi, eggs, breads, vegetables, salads, seafood...I could go on and on...  However the meats were the best part!  After I tried an array of things from the salad area, a troop of meat carvers came around with steak, chicken, pork, and lamb!  The meats were perfectly seasoned. I don't usually eat lamb but the lamb chops were too good to pass up!   I managed to save room for dessert and tried the bananas foster.  It was like banana pudding on crack! It was soo good.  I will defiantly be returning soon!!!

dMj8AGPuXjG6AIszX06f6Q.text: I went to the Texas De Brazil today,  I have to say I didn't think it was as good as the Texas De Brazil in Aruba.  So I was a little disappointed,  I didn't like how close the tables were to each other, it felt crowded.  When I  got up to walk to the salad bar or restroom I was bumping into people.  The food at the salad bar wasn't bad.  I just think for the price we paid there should have been more selections.  We ate there at 5:45 , its probably better to eat there later,  when we were at the salad bar there were a lot of people around it, the line was moving really slow. The meat selection was okay, but I think they gave really small pieces compared to what I remember in Aruba.   The deserts were really good. The waiter we had was slow it seemed like we waited along time for things, because they said they were busy,  restaurants always give that excuse. I don't know if I'll go back there, I feel for me its not worth the price since I don't eat that much.

jfC3RI_sd1MKfZvBv5YpPA.text: I visited Texas De Brazil this weekend with my mother and two of my siblings.  Each year we select a new place to visit, and include an agenda of events and restaurants.  This year we decided to "kick off" the weekend with dinner at this restaurant.    Everything started out great!  Our 45 min. wait was only 20 minutes, and once seated, we were quickly greeted by our server.  Our server's name is Maurice.  He began with an introduction of himself, along with a detailed explanation of the restaurant.  Which, I would like to add, is VERY unique!  Once Maurice finished his 10 minute spiel, he tried to encourage us to order alcoholic beverages (even though we all explained we were not interested).  We then helped ourselves to the salad bar, which was amazing!  A wide array of soup, salad, cheese, and a variety of various other small foods.  Once we were ready to begin the main course, we were greeted by many different meats.  All of which were truly mouthwatering, DELICIOUS!  The problem, and the 3 star rating, comes in at the conclusion of our meal.  We rarely saw our server, at least, until it was time for him to offer us dessert.  He tried to pursuade us to order something sweet to finish our evening.  We explained that we had already eaten more than we should have, yet he continued to be somewhat pushy.  When he finally realized we weren't budging, he seemed to get a little irritated.  At this point, we explained that we would like to receive our checks.  It took 30 minutes from the time we told him we wanted our check, and the time we actually received our checks.  And then, at the time we received the checks, we told Maurice that we had a coupon that we wanted to use.  Maurice seemed to be irritated even more by this.  Nonetheless, he walked away to allow us time to prepare payment.  From the time we received our checks to the time we were finally "cashed out", an HOUR had passed.  Mind you, only one time in that hour did Maurice stop by our table.  When he did, it was to inform us that the coupon was the reason things were taking so long.  I need to clarify that when we had first arrived to the restaurant, it was very busy.  But, now, around 9:30 at night, the restaurant was near empty.  So, to say that this was taking so long, seemed so completely ridiculous!  Not to mention, once we finally received our change and credit card slips to sign, Maurice lingered around our table.  It was so convenient for him to disappear during the hour we were waiting for our bills, yet once we were ready to leave, he was clinging on close by.  Needless to say, the service ruined the entire experience for us!  And, at $45 a person, it was VERY frustrating!  I sure hope others don't have the same experience!

VPLNMtQgxh605Ok7Y2ykCg.text: I have walked by this restaurant so many times and finally stopped in. It was amazing!! We have never experienced this type of dining before. Our waiter was so attentive and the rest of the staff as well. The food is amazing and they never leave you waiting for more. I would highly recommend this place to anyone. 5 stars for sure

twjciMyNFexKSffJKKWyuw.text: Meh.  Not terrible but not very good either.  I've been to several Brazilian steakhouses and this one was pretty disappointing in comparison.  Dirty lettuce on the salad bar, oversalted meat sometimes only lukewarm or overcooked.  Long wait for server to start our meal.  At $45/person (without drinks or dessert) it's much too expensive for what they deliver.  There are better options.

5jKDiIySPXeZtcoCCae0pA.text: Went here on a Saturday evening.  Three of us on a guys night out.  We were expecting to indulge in a little gluttony and drink and were not disappointed.  The skewered meat selection was great, the wait staff was attentive and the drinks were good.  The wait time for a table was just a few minutes.  While waiting, we sat at the bar and had a drink served by a friendly bartender.  Once seated, the waiter explained the concept to us and we started at the salad bar.  I'm not really sure you should call it a salad bar as there were selections of hot items, sides and more not found at a regular salad bar.  Once we turned our disks to "green" the real food started arriving.  Did I mention the big selection of meat?  Everything from chicken to beef to pork to...  Did I mention that there was a lot of well prepared skewered meat?  Some was slightly over salty, but overall it was all well cooked and seasoned.  If you go, bring a big appetite.  This place is appropriate for a group, party, family (although may be a bit much for smaller children) or any festive night out.   Not sure if I would recommend for a first date.

VydFLZIRabRF5Vt0RqiBUw.text: The food and service were excellent! If I had to describe it, it would be like Nicolas Cage set up a bunch of mirrors so it looked like there were infinite mirrors then stood in front of them whispering "Nicolas Cage" until he fell asleep standing up.

YZTSZZWGiVI6vTj7BqBE6A.text: I had dinner with my family here tonight and I can say that I left impressed. Being greeted with alluring smells and a friendly host staff was the start to a great night. Our waiter arrived quickly after we were seated and eased us right into the experience. Immediately I felt comfortable here, as if I'd been here daily my entire life. We were directed to a plentiful salad bar that featured much more than salad. From sushi to heart of palm, the salad bar buffet already had enough to fill me up. Luckily I was warned by a family member who had been here to wait for the main event: the meat. Everywhere I looked there were men bring around skewers of different types of freshly made meats. A buffet that is brought to you and consists of sampling filet Mignon, flank steak, bacon wrapped chicken, pork, sausage, lamb, ribs, etc. Who could ask for any more? And to top it off, the wait staff was kne of the best I've ever seen. Not once did my needs go unfilled. They knew what I needed before I had a chance to realize it myself. My glass of water did not empty once, I never had to scramble for room on the table, and the waiter kept up friendly conversation the entire time. I highly recommend Texas De Brazil.

TWKhSC7Nh08ILDucUrcoZA.text: Good brazilian steakhouse, average pricing tho. I recommend it to a friend. I'll definitely get back there!

_bCdiB-dhbF8_SiZkliLEQ.text: Good selection of meat and all you can eat. Service was great, some meat was well underdone almost raw, lamb was aweful but everything else was good. Very very expensive two of us two drinks and dessert with 20% tip was 170.00.

RrlvJ_me8cJQpghaXSyubw.text: I have eaten at this Brazilian steakhouse, as well as other locations of it, dozens and dozens of times. It is one of my favorite restaurants. The salad bar has almost 60 items. You must be careful to not fill up on the salad bar before the meat starts to come around. My favorite items from the salad bar are the lobster bisque (my favorite of any restaurant, and *always* the "soup of the day") and the potatoes. When you are ready for the meat, you turn over your card from red to green on your table. The several servers come around and offer you meats such as filet mignon, flank steak, lamb, pork, chicken, and sausage. Secret: You must ask for the yummy beef ribs. For some reason, the restaurant does not like to bring them around as they do with the other meats. You also get a few side items--mashed potatoes, fried banana, and cheesy bread, brought out to your table (included in the overall price). They offer several desserts for an additional fee. I notice that this location heavily pushes drinks at the end of the meal. I have been to many other Brazilian steakhouses, and Texas de Brazil is my favorite one.

kjNrwEsjXXsVFl0K5pdWsg.text: Not impressed, 40 minute wait for our table even with a reservation.  Certainly understaffed.  Won't be back.

S9FrRwpbScInqdziVIGbOw.text: I was very disappointed at this restaurant.  The service is horrible.  When they asked if we had been there before I mentioned that I had not, but I knew how Brazilian churrascaria's worked because I've been to Green Forest.  He looked at me like I was an idiot and had no idea what I was talking about. Come on, the only other Brazilian restaurant in Pittsburgh and you've never heard of it?   What brings people to these kinds of restaurants is the meat.  The servers that brought the meat came in waves.  You'd have three or four come by at once, then you'd be sitting there for an extremely long time looking around trying to get someone to come fill your plate.    We came during restaurant week, but only about half of the restaurant was filled, so there should be no excuse for the horrible service.  When we were finished eating, we sat around for a very long time before we were able to get our server's attention to get our bill.  And we were not the only ones sitting around twiddling our thumbs.    The quality of the meats and salad bar food was good, and was the only thing that redeems this restaurant.

h-aRdBUIyUTqPfAJLorpIQ.text: My husband loved it --I did not. So 3 stars it is. I thought the buffet was ok, the food I had was delicious but the assortment was a bunch of cheeses and lettuce. Not your ordinary buffet food. The soup was really salty and for lobster bisque there is no better than Wholey's so I'm spoiled. Anyhow on to the meat ... of all the meats we tried I only liked 1. I don't like heavily seasoned meat. My husband enjoyed most if the meat. The biggest shock was the cost of a soda! They give you a minuscule half bottle of soda and it's $6 each! I won't be going back because it wasn't worth the money to me. But like I said my husband enjoyed the all-you-can-eat meat but he still felt the price was too high for what we got.

e19zcR-VEwlPwdVb-C2WJw.text: This restaurant has something for everyone, you will not leave hungry! Everything I had for dinner was cooked and seasoned perfectly. The servers were courteous and patient. Great place, could be a bit pricey for some.

GOGC89soKoHLry-IU2DVzw.text: Pros: Cool atmoshere Great steak & lamb Good service Good side dishes  Cons: pork wasn't that good salad bar is lacking lobster bisque had NO lobster and was bland

rTMObVICOroJqTwpmypsIA.text: My husband and I had a great new dining experience at Texas De Brazil, one of the greatest eating experience we've ever had in a long time.  This was a completely new experience for us.  Our server, Livingstone made our experience enjoyable. he was attentive, courteous,and entertaining at the same time.  I loved it! it is definitely pricey but considering the quality of meat that they offer at an unlimited portion, it's understandable.  We had to come try the Brazilian restauant, it was well worth it! we'll be returning soon,hopefully!  I will be recommending Texas De Brazil to my family and friends.

f3-nPUFVnHG_xKd2Mfb23g.text: Service was very slow, they only brought steak to our table 1 time.  Soft drinks are $3 with no refills. Dessert is $9 and is stale dried out cake. We were seated 35 minutes before the first meat came to our table. We paid $110 for 2 people which is outrageous for what we received. Could have got a better meal at Golden Carrol.

kMJwuSA5U8zIxPI7BKicew.text: Meat galore!  Much of the meat is served medium to medium-rare...you can get some less rare, but it seems to be a little limited. Salad bar is fantastic!  If you get on their email list they will send you a sweet coupon.

Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

syq-7tPuRSGYgQrNfx5wlg.text: This is the restaurant that was chosen for our annual day after Christmas family dinner.  Value: Very pricey, but worth it. Beware of happy hour drink specials though, not every drink is discounted, i.e. gin and tonic was $10 and price of wine was very high.  Ambience: Upscale, very crowded, best make a reservation. Place is clean but lighting is VERY dim.  Food Highlights: Salad bar items were plentiful, fresh and delicious. The lamb chops were the bomb at medium rare perfection, some of THEEE best ever and so was the Brazilian Picanha. Didn't know sirloin could get that good. Filet Mignon, meh. Leg of lamb was tasty.  Service: Service was on point and awesome...until the checks arrived. Took about 1/2 hour to sort out check errors, including one that was $30 plus dollars off and NOT in our favor. Thus the four star rating.  After eating here be prepared to be stuffed for hours if not for days!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. go steelers!!!
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. lamb chop heaven
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. salad plate

oaYhYyD6Ob43C-roO_FwiQ.text: We ate here with a large group for my Dad's Birthday.  The food was awsome and the style of dining is unique.  The meats are fantastic.  The idea of trying lots of different types and cuts is very appealing.  While waiting for meat cuts the buffet is a great option.  I especially liked the sushi.  Great food, great experience!!!!

MgK5ZZheJG_BaPjCnPGsug.text: This place is the bomb,they cook their food so perfectly it's remarkable.The price isn't even that bad either for a great variety of meats.

bUUiK7KcuCX3SyjEs7wDaA.text: This meal was a study in contrasts: generally excellent food, outstanding service, and a most unappealing atmosphere.  From the moment we approached the host desk until the moment we left the restaurant, it was clear that we have to raise our voices to be heard by staff and ourselves. The restaurant is attractive.  It is unfortunate that individuals may dine here dressed as if they have come off the baseball field or in from a run; caps, athletic pants, and clothes with holes in them abounded. Our preference is seating a booth; there are no booths here.  We were placed at a table in the center of the noisy and frenetic dining room, so close to other tables that I was bumped by staff on multiple occasions. The salad bar was satisfactory, not great, and it is cramped.  I was disappointed that there were not marinated mushrooms and that the steamed asparagus had no seasoning: tasteless.  The potato salad and cabbage salad were delicious. There was only one soup, lobster bisque, something which has no appeal to one who does not enjoy seafood. With the exception of dry and tasteless pork that was brought to the table, we greatly enjoyed all of the succulent and flavorful meats.  The parsley-topped mashed potatoes were excellent.  No butter was provided or offered for the potatoes or for the mediocre, unheated tiny rolls that were provided. The rest room is tiny and inadequate: two urinals and two stalls, which was not enough to avoid a significant wait on a crazed Saturday night.  The meat servers were generally gracious and welcoming. The highlight of the meal was server Veronica, who immediately made us feel that we had known her for a long time.  She was attentive, efficient, welcoming, and charming, sincere when she said that she hopes to be able to serve us again.  My most recent visit to a churascarria had been at the King of Prussia Fogo de Chao, where my experience was far superior to Texas de Brazil.  For $44.99 per person, one expects excellence.  It is achieved here in food and service, but the atmosphere caused the evening to lack the enjoyment that we deserved.

ee33l5gIGuFogsHIPVJkEA.text: Texas de Brazil is 110% worth the money! If you have never been here, your next high roller date needs to be here!   For those who are unfamiliar, Texas de Brazil is a Brazilian steakhouse that is unique. You pay for a "dinner", which includes a long buffet that features salad, soup, sushi, and other appetizers, and all of the meat that the chefs are preparing. You are given a disc with one red and one green side. Flip the card to green when you need more food, and the servers will literally bring food to you and slice it onto your platter.   The staff here is absolutely amazing, charismatic, and quick. They are very quick in getting you seated and thoroughly explaining to you how their restaurant works if you're new there. The other servers are super friendly and make sure you're getting your money's worth.   For an authentic, unique Brazilian steakhouse experience, come check this place out. I guarantee you will get your money's worth, and unlike other fancy, expensive restaurants, Texas de Brazil will have you coming back for more!

4fDY5JObxTPWE5i6NEBBsw.text: Oh my god this place is amazing!! The meat is so good and so well cooked! I would 100% recommend this place!

ofejbJjPHq_jQfmiNXUhmQ.text: Another beautiful evening   with my lovely Wifey in a wonderful  place:   Texsas de Brazil.  I very much recommend to everyone who wants enjoyed delicious selection of meet and vine.
