P92y917w89T8chvn8tRyVg.text: This is a nice restaurant. The salad bar is definitely the star of the show. If you're going for the meat, be patient. Although the rest of the service was excellent, the gauchos' visits to the tables were fairly sparse and their selections were nothing to write home about. (Flank steak, sausage, chicken, and lamb--all lukewarm) All the staff was friendly. Knowing what I know now, if they had a salad bar only option, I would have chosen to do that. The salad bar had a wide variety of salads, cheeses, and deli meats.

SneIG5Iz_pF_jSkhPViY3A.text: The service on Christmas Eve was just amazing. We had a beautiful family meal and I attribute that to the service staff. They were elegant, gracious, kind, and on time with drinks, orders, and requests. The meats are very good but I have been to a better hot bar and buffet. I still highly recommend the experience.

jqNaPsLKQDKaaeEvaq-Iqg.text: As a vegetarian in a Brazilian steakhouse, I was surprised with the amount of food I was able to eat. They provide a cheaper salad bar only option which is more equipped than your average salad bar.  The cold bar had your usual salad and veggie toppings, bread, cheese, etc. There's a smaller hot bar side with soup (not vegetarian that night sadly), rice, beans, mushrooms, and potatoes. I had more than enough options to choose from - maybe too much because I was dying at the end from too much food! Additionally, at the table, they provide cheese bread, mashed potatoes, and sweet plantains.  Dessert is not included in the meal and unfortunately, you'll have to pay extra if you want that slice of cake. A server comes to you with a tray of options. They have various cakes, pies, an creme brulee. We decided to pass on the dessert because 1) the sweet plantains served as a good dessert and 2) my stomach was already in pain from all the food at the bar.   My biggest complaint would be the disorganized service. Knowing it would be a busy time, we came equipped with a reservation, however, we were not seated until 15 minutes after despite seeing empty tables throughout the room. Even after we were seated, we kept receiving calls because some of the hosts did not realize we were already eating.   At the table, you get cards to notify the meat servers whether you want them to come up to you or not. Obviously as a vegetarian and having only purchased the salad bar option, mine was flipped over to the 'No Thanks" side. Despite that, servers kept asking me if I wanted meat and one even threw a slice of pork on my plate after I said no. I think the systems has some kinks it could work out.  Despite a few disappointing moments with service, Texas de Brazil gets a 4 star rating from me. The variety and quality of the food went above my expectations. Even though I could eat any of the meat, it was a fun experience to see the unique serving system. I would definitely return in the future (but maybe with less form fitting clothes)

o_i8nCEuLKv2Lsm7Da24sA.text: Nice variety of meats and seasonings. Lamb was the best. Little pricey but a fun experience. Hungry teenage carnivores got their money's worth.

zvo3s2AaCC7zvkwZ_TRPww.text: We love this restaurant so much that we came here after our wedding , with that being said we came in this evening for a random dinner and had the best service out of any of our visits to date. Vlad is fantastic and deserves a raise!!! And as always the food was outstanding, THANK YOU

CRO9NkytEmbzKjvbSVMNdw.text: We finally tried it (after having been to Green Forest years ago), knowing it would be a TON of food. We both like the decor and location much better than Green Forest. Texas de Brazil seemed to have a more varied meat selection, but sadly they do not do the cinnamon grilled pineapple (my favorite dish that went around Green Forest). The service was amazing and the food was delicious! A couple things we got later were a bit overcooked, but the first round was all perfectly prepared, too.  TONS of food, so we definitely can't go to restaurants like this often, but the food was worth the unhappy stomach.  The bar was nice, too. Great happy hour specials were surprising and the service there was great, too. Amanda was wonderful. Sadly, I don't remember our waitress' name. I only remember Amanda's, since a friend of ours who's a bartender is also named Amanda. Ha ha ha...

FXN8yVpEOnzZhrekcjUsUg.text: This is absolutely hands down the best place on Earth to treat yourself to a high quality meal. The meats are to die for, especially the bacon wrapped filet mignon. The lobster bisque is out of this world. I can't leave without eating at least two bowls of it. Be sure to sign up for their email club to receive discounts.

A9zqXDPTtu0G-oYjbLfnqw.text: One of the best stake house i ever been, so many choices, good meet, small portions but you eat as much as you want, good service, clean and with very good atmosphere, we arrive 6personal after a long day in work, we get hood service. Price is a little bit high but it's worth it.

6oWUdwEaDNU2G6xFt9DtNg.text: Let me preface this by saying I grew up on a cattle ranch in Montana and I never went a day without eating meat in some form. I LOVE meat, and if your like me you've been to many restaurants, had a steak, but it doesn't quite fill you up. Sometimes these meats are upwards of 30 to 40 dollars. Then someone told me their was a place for me. A place that had unlimited meats, and not just beef, but lamb, pork, fish and salads and cheeses. Immediately it called to my mind visions of a Golden Corral and I was very skeptical.  For 45$? How could that be good for that price? I was so wrong. The meats are cooked perfectly (although the filet mignons were a little over cooked) and the lamb chops were the best I have had. The waitstaff were also amazingly friendly. It gets even better: an upscale bar inside served amazing cocktails for very reasonable prices. I am hooked. I will return again and again. If you like meat, this place will be your go to for sure if you are really really hungry.

ienVQdyf1hMxPJFns2Mivw.text: This was my first time here. We wanted to try something new for our anniversary. The salad bar and service was exceptional! But the only complaint is they don't allow you to take home leftovers, which this place isn't cheap! I don't think we will be coming back.

Xyg3rkwXb_MI1tjYH9l1eA.text: the first time I came here I was blown away by how amazing it was. the meats were delicious, the salad bar was incredible, the desserts were to die for.   i've been here 3 times now and I continually get let down by how sub par it gets with each additional visit. the meats are just okay, the salad bar remains great, and the desserts aren't as good. the service has been on a steady decline as well.   it's not to say i'll never be back again, maybe a few years down the road.

YETv-21LWWLWXXbhOKFbig.text: Best steakhouse restaurant in  town, absolutely worths every penny.   I'm very please that I went today to Texas De Brazil, the staff is very efficient and friendly .

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lam Ribs

3qwBtCXmeQmKq-o8JK1DIg.text: My husband and I had dinner reservations here yesterday 4/28/18. One word comes to mind AMAZING! Our reservations was for 7:45 we had about a 15 minute wait, but they kept us in the loop and was very friendly and polite. The decor was very nice, the chandeliers were high end vintage with a dash of modern, wood tables with nice comfortable chairs, a big block candle burning on each table with white cloth lien napkins, and blue goblet drinking glasses and basic silverware. The salad bar area had everything from shrimps to lobster bisque soup. It's not your average salad bar, it was well prepared, maintained, and clean. They give you a basket of these little round ball style of rolls. I did not like, but my husband did. Meat, meat, meat all kinds of meat! Chicken wrapped bacon, filet migon wrapped bacon, chicken parmesan, pork parmesan, lamb chops, Brazilian sauage(my favorite), flank steak, ribs, etc. if you're a vegan or vegetarian stay home or go to another restaurant unless you don't mind friends/family eating meat in front of you. You can do salad bar only. My husband had two strawberry style Brazilian drink, it was strong and good. It was crowded around this time and the noise was a little loud with everyone talking. Lights are dimmed, so it's kind of romantic. It was our anniversary. They gave us one free dessert, we went with the banana foster to take home. It was tasty. This is a place I would go to once a year because it's way too much meat (lol). I would suggest that they have cards on each table letting the diners know the selections of meat for that day. They do ask is there a meat you would like them to bring over, but how would you know all the meats? Overall, a very pleasant dining experience and our waiter was very attentive and polite. I would recommend to family and friends.

LlHC9-vZGhfKYQdtrrC6_w.text: What a great experience!  My husband wanted to treat me to a nice dinner since we have been like two ships passing in the night lately,  so he made reservations here.  We had never been before,  so we didn't know exactly what to expect,  but we were pleased.    Our server,  Connor,  was wonderful!  He was very thorough in his explanation of how the dining experience was going to go as far as foods and what meats would be offered.  We opted for a bottle of wine to share, even though it was a bit pricey.... and I ended up drinking most of it myself.   The meats were cooked to medium rare,  which my husband likes,  but I like mine more medium well.  The men going around the dining area were polite when I asked for my meats to be cooked longer and were prompt in returning with them.    My hubby ordered the Brazilian cheesecake for dessert while I visited the restroom.  Very nice restroom by the way!  Dessert was wonderful!  Fudge, cheesecake, caramel & pecans.... YUM!   The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars..... The price.  Our bill ended up being $150 before tip. Had we not gotten the bottle of wine,  it would have been much less,  but hey "when in Rome" as they say. We knew it would be expensive, and it was good, but I think it's a bit over priced.  Other than that,  great experience & we will probably be back on a special occasion like our 1 year wedding anniversary in November!

liSbmRMkltk3f1yGj2VPbg.text: I enjoyed my dinner but wasn't hungry enough to get my money's worth. $45 per person is ok when you eat a lot. The salad bar was smaller than the other steakhouse I went to but it was pretty good. The meat was good. I enjoyed everything but the flank steak. The sausage, parmesan chicken and lamb chops were my favorites. The bananas they give you to cleanse your palate are delicious so were the beans and rice and scalloped potatoes. The lobster bisque was outstanding!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The way u tell them not to bring anymore meat.

xZjf-2D8Sm3FrTko2O612A.text: Food is good, but well over priced for the number of other Brazilian Restaurants we have been to.   Atmosphere was not great the tables were far too close together, we felt rushed by the staff and it was extremely loud and I wasn't even able to hear my wife across the table, again quite different than the other Brazilian Restaurants we have been to.   For the price point it's not somewhere I see us going again when the Melting Pot is across the street.

fM36BgRlAAnprVGkZ3RVKg.text: Food is outstanding (lamb chop was a bit gamey for my taste but everything else is phenomenal) l! The wine selection is unbelievable but the service isn't exactly desirable. Been here twice and disappointed with the waitresses ONLY. Everyone else is great (hostess, servers of meet)

WkA9ILNe2CkPbJmWGrvOkw.text: A group of us recently dined at Texas de Brazil on a Thursday evening.  We had a 6:00 reservation and were seated immediately.  Our server came over, was quite informative about the beverage options and the majority of our party went to the salad bar.  Upon getting our plates the meat parade began.   We had multiple servers visit our table offering us multiple different types of meat.  All were delicious.  We were also asked if we had any favorites and they were sent over as well.  I highly recommend the bacon wrapped filet, lamb roast, and short rib.  Garlic mashed potatoes were tasty as well.  This restaurant is built on exemplary service.  Managers stopped by to check on us, wait staff was phenomenal.  They even offer 20% discount for a myriad of individuals (police, firefighters, education).  This isn't a place I'd go weekly but it is excellent.  Yes it is salty but the food is exceptional.  Keep up the great work!

ta6IfUMEuFID5GataSd1EA.text: First 2 times we visited the service and food were 1st class....each time after that( about 3 more times) the service got worse each time. This is always on a Sunday. The food was slow to come to the table. Many times left with nothing on our plates for long periods!  We finally decided not to ever go back. Too much money for such poor service. Potential is there.... food is good... when you can get it

UYP_p2pZKLIOmYtwMDF3Pw.text: This is truly a meat lover's paradise. We went here with a coupon that we received after signing up for the mailing list (apparently this is the smart way to dine here). Servers were pretty attentive and helpful in getting us started with our first time here. As we first started out, we were pretty much swarmed with all different cuts of meat. It was cool at first, though as we ate through I think it would've been preferable to eat more slowly and get our food a bit at a time. The red/green indicators that we had were pretty much ignored most of the time--they were on red at the beginning when we were swarmed, and then for the 15 minutes afterward as well, though the gauchos still kept asking us whether we wanted more. Later on, it seemed that they got tired of us and stopped asking, so even when I turned mine back to green I had to be a bit proactive in getting food.   The food itself was overall very tasty. My favorite cuts of meat were probably the picanha, filet, and lamb chops--super tender, lots of flavor. At the beginning we wanted to sample everything, though later on we realized that there really is no need to. Use your judgment and just get the ones you feel good about. One particular cut was rather dry and we realized that it looked that way as well. Other than the meats, the sides were fantastic, especially the cheese bread and fried bananas. The unlimited salad bar was top notch as well, which included a lot of different cheese and cold seafood options. Great way to balance out all that meat. Though your wallet might want you to eat like 90% meat to get your money's worth, your stomach would be much happier if you kept that down to like 40-60% and fill up the rest at the salad bar.

-_DNohyGiOwOsvape4ekqg.text: I really enjoyed dining her. The service is amazing! The waitress and manager were so nice and friendly. They always made sure that we were all okay. The food is really good! I love the salad bar. When I was there, they had the au gratin potatoes and sauteed mushrooms that are to die for. My favorite meats were the lamb chop and filet mignon. The meat was so flavorful and tender. I cannot wait to return!

U5spKmxkeNXwPNcTJ87AzQ.text: Not too hungry? Go for the light dinner - consists just their "salad bar" - which is filled with great stuff! Want meat? Oh do they have meat! It's all very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beautiful dinning room.

mty3qbhvvVfT_hC0CmMpPA.text: Meat, meat and more meat. If you love meat, you'll probably love this place. If you like meat, it will still be okay, but you may not love it. That's where I'm at with this joint.   I love lamb, and while the lamb chops were good, the rack of lamb of lamb wasn't really. The filet was excellent, as was expected. The other meats were good as well. I guess where I felt the place was missing was the salad bar.   The other Brazilian steakhouse I've been to had a bomb salad bar. While meat should be the strongest thing, I feel the salad bar should be equal. You can't have a great meal without great sides, right?! Mostly everything I picked up off the bar I wasn't thrilled about. And it was a smaller selection than I thought it would be.   Service was excellent, but i would have expected that one because they must be attentive to be bringing you all the meat, meat and more meat and two because the place was pretty dead. It will cost you a pretty penny if you're not indulging though, since the whole meal is around $44. At that point you almost HAVE to keep the courses coming just to get your money's worth. And that, my friends, is not worth it to me.

jUcSmPgl0g6vS7Kym_H0OA.text: It was good. No cookie with my cappuccino and dessert took forever. But meat and salad bar were good.

-rx_8LH5-YwAxZfmYiycoQ.text: I had a free entree coupon for my birthday so we figured we would give the newest Brazilian steak house in town a try.    Upon entering, I was immediately struck by how cold and unwelcoming it felt.  It was rather industrial in decor and seemed like they were trying too hard to be trendy.  We were the first table seated for the evening, so everyone was eager to bring food, drinks, etc.    First, drinks are very expensive.  Not that I didn't expect that given the type of meal and location, but $2.50 for a non refillable eight ounce bottle of coke seems a bit extreme.  The salad bar looked impressive, but I was expecting more.  Everything I tried was decent, but nothing jumped out as remarkable.  I was also hoping for more than just one type of sushi.  I felt the same way about the meats.  It did not seem that there was the variety that there were at other Brazilian steak houses that I have been to.  All of the meat was decent, but none stood out as favorites.  If I did have to name a favorite, it would be the lamb chop.  It seemed that rather than have a variety of meats and flavors, the same flavors were put on two or three different meats.    Service was exceptional.  Constant refills on water, meat, etc.  We were also visited twice by managers to ask if everything was OK with our meal and if we needed anything.  Overall an OK experience, but not worth what the price would have been if we paid for two dinners.  Next time I want a Brazilian steak experience, I'll stick with Green Forest in Penn Hills.

OVVw7xwo-6xscIR-Zqn0UA.text: Food was fantastic.  Huge salad bar with many interesting and tasty items. Chicken, ribs,pork and beef all perfectly done. Sadly,  none of these closer to home but definitely a must visit when in Pittsburgh. Specialty cocktails quite potent.

Otp2292JnSsCWQMa5XtPGg.text: This place is amazing. The food is delicious. Meat is cooked to perfection. We had Paula as our server and she went above and beyond. She constantly checked in on us. Her recommendations on drinks were spot on.   If you have never been here before come hungry. They give you a card that you flip to green when you are ready for more and flip to red when you need a break.  The manager also stopped at our table to make sure everything was meeting our needs.   I will definitely be back!

1hrAjUnlNpSgiZxyDdzrIg.text: Great dinner!! Excellent service! Food was perfect and the deserts were amazing.. as for Micah... great server!

bzYX_9qIj1ZqUgPbkpXtWg.text: Do you want to go somewhere that's super impressive but the same exact thing in every city that it's housed in? Then come here.   I gotta admit, I walked in those GIGANTIC doors and was floored (haha, get it? This is an architecture pun...) by how huge everything was. It really is a great place to feel like you're at a crazy expensive joint. At the same time, it really is just kinda like a cheesecake factory of meat.  If you've never been to a churrascaria place and you're in Station Square and you're looking for something impressive, this will definitely be interesting to you. HOWEVER, there are MUCH better places in Pittsburgh you can go. Yet, I will still explain to you what churrascaria is (because we just established that you haven't been to one before).  You pay two different options of prices here (other places have other options): everything or vegetarian. With the everything option, you get unlimited meat of different types brought to your table and then you can have unlimited stabs (haha, another pun) at the salad bar which has far more than salad at it. If you couldn't tell, if you get the vegetarian option, you just can eat at the salad bar.  THE MOST IMPORTANT THING TO REMEMBER: the cheesy bread puffs they bring are like HEAVEN in your mouth! Eat them! Savor them! But don't fill up on them!  Anyway, moving onto the review of this actual location, having been to other churrascaria places, I was really disappointed by how few different cuts of meat they brought around. They were supposed to have some ridiculous number (like over 20 or something), but we were only ever brought about 8 different kinds. This really made me feel like they were trying to cheapskate everyone. At Green Forrest, we literally tried every single kind they make.  So basically? I'll never go here again, but if you're visiting Pittsburgh and don't have a car or something, sure... try this place out.

0eFUQrEd9f3p1tGUppRH8A.text: I really didn't want to come here, because I really despise going to Station Square.  On top of that I'm not a big meat eater but my brother has been dying to try this place so I went. The place was packed which you would think is a good sign but since the majority of people seem to think that fine dining IS a chain restaurant, that didn't tell me much.   You have two options you can either do the salad bar on its own or you can have the salad bar with the meat courses - they have traveling servers who make their way around the dining room with various meat options to offer diners who have ordered full service.  Each person gets a small card with green on one side and red on the other.  Green means that you want meat (or ordered the meat in addition to the salad bar), red means no more meat, and no card means you just ordered the salad bar.  I opted to just go for the salad bar as there was a lot of interesting options available from fresh veggies and cheeses to shrimp, pastas, and salads.  They also had some hot bar items like lobster bisque, roasted potatoes, etc.  My brother and his girlfriend decided to each get the meat with the salad bar, but it ended up that neither of them ate much meat because the salad bar had so much to offer.  Overall the food was good, but it just didn't knock my socks off.   Our server also charged me for the meat option when I only had the salad bar and it was a little bit of a hassle to get it fixed and mostly that was just annoying given that I'd had a conversation with her about my choice prior to making my decision to just go with the salad bar.  Also, the meat servers kept reaching over me to serve meat to others at the table, which was incredibly annoying and also simply lacking proper serving etiquette.  It was a typical "fancy" chain restaurant experience.  I can't say that I'd race back there again, but I wouldn't object to going there, though I know that given it's location at Station Square that they will not have any trouble staying busy.  If you really LOVE meat, then this really is the place for you, but if you just "like" meat and the thought of eating pounds of it to get your money's worth then you might be better off going somewhere else.

IRaUmFfO3hkTWE217VnRNw.text: BJ may not be my Daddy, but I took him to Texas De Brazil for Father's Day anyway!  We have dined at locations in Florida and Illinois, so we knew exactly what to expect from Texas De Brazil.  But what we didn't expect was the "Burghin-ization" of this chain.  At other locations, you are greeted at an elegant and serene hostess stand away from the dining room.  In Da Burgh, it's more like walking into a high school gymnasium.  We had to shout at the hostess so she could hear our names.  The acoustics are horrendous.  The beautiful lighting fixtures are lost in the din of the ugly black ceiling.  The tables are helter skelter.  As another diner mentions, you can't go to the ladies room without having to knock at least 3 people over.    The elegant salad bar topped with their signature massive floral arrangement seems surrounded by the homeless lining up for their last meal.  Even the gauchos are different here.  Some of them are a wee bit timid, rather then proudly strutting around to show their meat. Maybe they will get of the hang of it.  Maybe not.  Where are the elegant white table linens?  Where is the incredible service?  To our dear servers, I am sure you are exhausted.  But please don't complain to me about how hard to you have to work and how much your feet hurt.  I am here to celebrate!  Only in Pittsburgh.  Now if you can just get by all that.....  We loved dining here.  Even with the lack of ambiance and stiff service, the food is still the number one star.  The salad and hot food bar is amazing.  The lobster bisque is delicious.  The salads are incredible.  And the Brazilian potato salad and marinated veggies are so good.  I am in love with the  pineapple carpaccio.  We loved adding the mushrooms with our beef.  And I am not sure why, but every meat tastes extraordinary at TDB.  Love the anticipation of waiting to see what yummy meat will show up our table next.  When we weren't seeing the bacon wrapped filet, we had to ask for it.  And we had to ask a second time.  So, don't be timid about asking for anything in particular.  For dessert, not included, we shared an incredible slice of pecan pie a la mode.  Sweet ending to an incredible meal.  Just a couple of helpful tips.  Try not to eat anything on the day of your visit.  Maybe even the evening before.  It would be a shame to not be able to try all of the TDB offerings.  And be sure to visit their web site and sign up for their E-club.  I see a free birthday and anniversary meal in your future.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hungry BJ enjoying Texas De Brazil on Father&#39;s Day!
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad Bar

ge7Asj4I_Xx4rMrIyEVn7A.text: Horrible experience.  If you are sitting away from where they roast the meats you are going to get the short end of everything.  We didn't have any steak sent to us until 30 min after sitting down.  We've been here many times and they've clearly gone downhill.  I think if you have kids they just bring you the chicken and pork.  For the price of the meal it's unacceptable.  Service was sloooow.

9Ot_7J8Inf7krVHynuLQWw.text: This past Saturday my husband insisted that we have lunch here. Once we finished with our just ducky tour we still had about 30 minutes to go. I thought this might deter him however he was very determined to have his steak and eat it too ( pun intended)  If you're in the mood for something special please please check this place out yes the prices are pricey but you can pretty much get a good sense of that from the outside. I have been to a restaurant very similar to this in San Antonio Texas and they really do not disappoint. If you were any kind of meat connoisseur and just really generally like food you will find this restaurant right up your alley. The salad bar that they have in the middle of the restaurant is a meal all in itself serving everything from rice and beans, to fresh vegetables and shrimp! My daughter was also impressed at the bowl of random bacon that was strategically place next to the bread yes bacon!  This restaurant will give  you a taste of all of the meat you can think of lamb, chicken, and beef. When you enter the restaurant and are seated it is explained to you in depth how everything works if your coaster is on the green they will continuously walk past your table and offer you various cuts of meat to include Brazilian sausage, I love sausage  Again this place is a little pricey but it's definitely worth the extra stretch if you're planning on eating here I do recommend that you come very hungry because if you don't you will have wasted approximately $30.  All in all my service was very good and I am glad this is where my Saturday lunch landed.

OmwLG8iIU6ZcQg_MJjohZg.text: I hadn't eaten in a week (I kid) it had only been since breakfast, but my family and I were hungry and what better place to eat then at an all you can eat Brazilian restaurant. My family (wife and 2 x kids 12 / 10) really enjoyed our experience here and the kids loved it too.   For lunch and adult meal is $30, $15 for kids 12 and under. The bread, salad, cheese station was also pretty good as well. Every piece of meat was divine, but my favorites were the beef cuts. We finished our meal off with an espresso and I had a cappuccino. We would definitely be back.

oBjZmNkMp02brUcqZ2iEBg.text: 5 Star service for sure. Our serve I believe was named Vlad. He was so great. Despite being a large and crowded place, he was incredibly accommodating. He explained he menu perfectly and brought us lots of different sauce options. The servers walking around with the different meats were also all exceptionally nice. They were funny and sweet and came around multiple times. The food itself at this establishment isn't really for me, but that's not knocking the quality of it. I was there for a birthday dinner, I didn't choose it. But the food itself you could tell was good if that's what you like. They had a wide variety of steaks, chickens, lamb, pork, sausage. The salad bar was unique, with soups, sushi, etc. if you are coming hungry and like meat, you will absolutely get your moneys worth

_dv_dljZGVXpo9h0-QFyzg.text: Just visited Texas de Brazil for the 2nd time and it was an AWFUL dining experience. We were part of a group of 6 who had a reservation, but when we arrived, we saw the hostesses scrambling to find a table for us. Once seated, we waited approximately 15 minutes to receive drinks, and approximately 25 minutes until ANY meat was brought to our table. The server asked us how we wanted our meat cooked to which the entire table said medium. I'm not sure WHY they even ask this question since every piece of beef we were served was rare, verging on completely raw. Once the meat did start coming to our table, we waited about 5-7 minutes between servings. The meat here is like a game of Russian Roulette, you never know if you are going to get a good piece or if it is completely full of fat. When the waitress sent the manager to our table my husband was explaining to him that tho we understand that the typical temperature of the meat is generally medium rare, we are getting meat that is completely rare. The manager was extremely rude and cut my husband off as he was speaking. His attitude turned us off COMPLETELY. I can go to McDonalds and not be spoken to with such disrespect as this fellow exhibited. He later came over to the table to try to chat but at that point he had already ruined an already bad meal for us so we just wanted him to go away and leave us alone. We will NEVER be returning.

2Imdarc9JAbJ_i6Cnmv-pg.text: Had reservations for a party of 13 (parent's anniversary).  The hostess was friendly and seated us right away (I was 10 min late due to traffic.)  We had two people/waiters assigned to us.  They were fantastic.  Made great drink recommendations, kept everyone's glasses full (water, pop, alcohol...all full) and they took pix for us, gave a comp dessert to my mother for her anniversary and genuinely made it an enjoyable evening.  The servers were all very friendly and at our table without delay.  And the food....amazing.  Just superb.  Chef also visited us and spent some time talking to us (or maybe he was the GM, not sure).  The evening, food, and service could not have been better.  Thanks for helping make a great celebration.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Complimentary dessert! Crme Brle

0IcPIaFH8Sp9-5YbA65yHA.text: I can some of this incredible experience with the word amazing. The wait staff the food the overall experience was top notch. I cannot say enough good things about our dining experience here.

iqQwYUWXl7vU7hy9Ir0xbQ.text: Ok this is always a fun time. I've been to a few of these. This was my 3rd favorite of the 3 and the only chain. However lots to like. Service was an A++. It was a tight ship that really gave you the cyclone of meat experience. When we dropped a napkin someone came running to replace it unprompted. The salad bar was extensive. Lobster bisque in particular was stand out. As well as the filet and lamb chops. The other meat choices were, fine. Some a bit dry like the chicken. Anything wrapped in bacon was incredibly salty. Other Brazillian grills I went to had more daring meat choices like chicken hearts, alligator, seared shark. All in all a really fun macho night out. I had to carry my friend out over my shoulder like we were reinacting the movie Platoon.

Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon wrapped filet

8UvMnA3CeodzPnFC9laooA.text: I love this station square location. Food is outstanding. Service is awesome and I would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TMaPgwnvSss1A5odlGA6Gg.text: This visit was for Veterans Day, where they offer a few meal to all vets and 20 percent off to 6 people with them. Awesome in general! The gentlemen up front was fantastic. We had reservations, otherwise the wait was 2.5 hours. Which should be expected considering it's a holiday plus the free meals, ppl were of course less than polite about the wait time. He was always very polite and straight forward regardless, calming guests and thanking them for waiting. The service once we got to the table was fantastic as well. Everyone was really friendly and the food was great.  Nice event. Well done Texas de Brazil.

o9E0jxPSA9si1j2DhV2odA.text: Reservations on opentable a good idea!  Salad bar has valuable offerings!  Servers come by with beef, chicken, pork, and lamb that is carved table side.  You can request special cooking like to well done if you desire otherwise expect medium rare to medium on the beef.  Service is quick!  Good wine list.  Desserts are excellent - I prefer the Brazilian cheesecake and flan. Overall would go back!

2mgfKwliP4HR4zm3EM4dlw.text: My mother and I decided to bring my father here for Father's Day earlier this year and the dining experience was quite enjoyable. My mother and I sat at the bar and had a few cocktails while we waited for my dad to show up (which took a minute) and finally moved on to sampling the extensive side bar. The side food was yummy and, while more plentiful than the last Brazilian steakhouse we went to in Vegas, was not extremely varied. The main course of the MEATS was delicious. The lamb chops were divine! I'm not a very big red meat eater (I don't even like steak), but the experience more than makes up for fairly straightforward menu. Most of the meats were distinct enough from one another that it didn't feel like we were being forced to eat one giant slab of meat for 2 hours. We had a lovely time and would recommend to anyone looking foe r a dining experience rather than a simple meal!

tfA6ti4G3EHlCWci8-eGRg.text: My husband and I were in town visiting our best friends. Of course we just had to go to Texas de Brazil there. Service was slow in getting our meat. And when we finally got our meat, it was so under cooked. Our waiter was not very personable. We have never been to a TDB that had mediocre service. Company was much more pleasant then the food served and staff that waited on us.

6vNMH649kBR6K3-rmXXhlQ.text: The nastiest hostess I've dealt with in a long time. We got there at 3:56 for their 4:00 opening. There were several tables seated, doors were open and people going in and out. She made us wait outside for the 4 minutes til opening. Then ignored us when we came in after 4 and pretended she couldn't find our reservation. Really a depressing way to start an expensive dinner.  Server was fine. Food is good. Whole atmosphere is a spectacle and pleased my 80 year old father and 16 year old boy. I'd take my family back if they want to go but I wouldn't go by choice. That hostess really put a damper on the experience.

Ehbbiw_74Xumd04No2-wTQ.text: I was very impressed by the cuts available for restaurant week! For $35, the dinner included lamb chops and filet mignon. Most restaurant week deals in other Brazilian BBQ establishments in other cities (such as Fogo de Chao and Chima) have removed these items to cut costs so I'm very pleased that TdB stands ahead of the pack in that regard.   Furthermore, I tend to prefer my steak prepared rare and the gauchos did a fantastic job honoring that request. Along those lines, the service was also speedy and the pao de quejo came out piping hot.   I am only docking a star for the lack of swordfish and seared pineapple that is often served at Brazilian BBQ. The salad bar could also use some maintenance and more options such as kale could be included. Other than that, all of the meats were of exceptional quality and cooked exactly to my liking.

GyUvGz0z2VAuUdaosYDfmA.text: This was chosen as the surprise dinner for my birthday on a Sunday evening around 7:00. I was very excited because I have heard a lot about this place and keep forgetting to go during restaurant week.  We had a reservation and waited maybe 10-15 minutes to be seated, but the place was packed and I don't think they set tables aside for reservations necessarily, but I would definitely make one because we noticed others waiting for a lot longer than we did.   The waitress was extremely busy so she ran through what they were all about and recommended some drinks. Throughout the meal, though, she did come back to refill drinks and such.   We went up to the salad bar first to check it out.  It's not your standard salad bar- there's sushi, cured meats, cheeses, pickled vegetables, bread, different dips and sauces, a huge cheese wheel that you hack away at to get a few bits, soups (lobster bisque yum), and side options for your meats like warm wine infused mushrooms. The salad bar portion featured only lettuce, marinated tomatoes, croutons, fried bacon strips, and salad dressings. They don't have all the toppings that you're used to at a typical salad bar- but everything tasted great and the salad dressings looked and tasted homemade.   When we returned, there were fried plantains and a bowl of awesome mashed potatoes to accompany our meats.  We flipped our cards to green and, even though it was packed, immediately every 5 or so minutes there'd be a different type of meat making its way to us.  The brazilian sausage was AMAZING, the garlic rubbed steak was awesome, as were the lamp chops and ribs.  The only thing we didn't care for that we tried was the Parmesan chicken - it is chicken thighs, which I am not a fan of. It was a little gamey and really greasy and not very good.  They also offered me a free dessert since I was celebrating my birthday- I chose creme brulee which was delicious!  I really enjoyed this experience, but like so many others, you get more full then you've ever felt and tell yourself you will never go back because you've had enough. It's definitely, in my opinion, more suitable for a birthday, anniversary, or other special occasion, and not for everyday dining. However I would definitely return and bring some more family members merely to see their faces when presented with meat upon meat upon meat!

2g4MiA1Wh4xPul3smdeX7A.text: I was expecting this place to have stepped up their game since Fogo de Chao is a mile away now. Not the case.  Just one disappointment after another.   None of the meats left you hoping they will be around again soon. And... the selections of meats were slim and very infrequent.    Throw that on top of the numerous mistakes... it was almost comical.  You would think the service would get better after you complained 1/2 through dinner, but it just snowballed into a train wreck.

eyxng6pc76-dyui1xHYDnQ.text: I took my fiancee here 11/3/18 for her birthday dinner. I was not sure what to expect, having never been to this type of restaurant and only having a vague idea of what a churrascaria was. The process was clearly explained and we were set to go.   To start, the salad area was very good. There was a huge variety of items to start our meal with. I loved the cheese varieties and the couscous.   After this, basically every meat brought to the table was absolutely wonderful. All the beef selections were perfectly medium rare, my personal favorite. I really enjoyed getting to have a small portion of everything offered instead of filling up on one choice.   Additionally, I cannot say enough about our server, Rich. He was incredibly attentive without being the least bit overbearing. Any and all questions we had were answered thoroughly and immediately. He was very friendly and definitely helped to make our meal one of the most enjoyable we've had. If you are planning on dining here, I highly suggest asking for him.   All things considered, our experience at Texas de Brazil was top notch. I strongly recommend having a delicious meal here.

G8L1XGrkwbFsNCbpCReOQw.text: One of the best Brazilian steakhouses. You like meat? This is the place for you. I thought the garlic sirloin was the best choice out of them all. They also offer a healthy sized salad bar for all those that don't necessarily eat meat but the veggies choices are fairly lacking - don't bring any vegetarians to a Brazilian steakhouse four sure. Also the desert is also fairly good - the Brazilian cheesecake was amazing. I would come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

eRLEy0gWkwo9mI4pH4CSTg.text: We had dinner on a Saturday night.  We got there at 6:30 and was told about a 90 min wait.  We weren't in a hurry and waited.  We were seated about 75min.  Decent salad bar.  Along with smoke salmon, cod, sauteed mushrooms, lobster bisque, California rolls.  This is a Brazilian BBQ.  So I didn't expect much from the bisque and California rolls.  The servers will the BBQ meats were slow and we complained about the lack of food.  The manager came by and apologized and the bbq meats came out fast and often.  We had the lamb chops, filet, pihcanha.  Very tasty!  One complaint would be that the seasoning and the cooking was inconsistent. Some of the meats were too salty.  I asked for medium rare and some were well done and some cooked perfectly.

gHkVkbkDa6ERZjij2pLlzQ.text: Wow. If you leave this place hungry, shame on you. We dined here for pittsburghrestaurantweek... and loved our experience. The salad bar is what gives it the 4 instead of 5 stars. The selections were not anything spectacular. I was expecting something a bit more Latin or Brazilian. The guachos were a bit slow to come around in the beginning, but soon were to frequent and brought delicious everything. The bacon wrapped filet was out of this world. The leg of lamb was to die for. Our wine took a while to get to the table but wine service was great. I was so full I brought dessert home. For the restaurant week special the $35.14 price was amazingly worth it. They ended up getting $125 from us because of alcohol and coffee. I will definitely be back. Desiree was our fabulous server. Her awesome accent made it a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dessert... Key lime pie. Delicious

nmu3x-fjU4fryIk89cBnWQ.text: DO NOT EAT HERE. If I could give this place no stars whatsoever, then I would. (1) Our waitress was slow and forgetful. They were either understaffed or overbooked but neither is a good excuse for poor service. (2) My husband found a women's hair in his salad bar items and/or baked into the cheese biscuit, which we *might* have overlooked BUT... (3) A mouse was running in and out of the wine cellar area behind us and into the restaurant - a mere 20 feet away from the kitchen. As if that wasn't bad enough, the staff and manager's reactions were horrifying: First, they did not seem to care or mind that a rodent was running loose. It was almost as if they knew about the problem before it happened. (2) I had to actually persuade the manager to take care of our bill. Unfortunately, his solution was to only slightly discount our meal rather than completely comping it. We're not the type of couple to ever ask for freebies - I even offered to pay for the wine, hoping to suggest that we were not inclined to pay for a meal after such a horrifying experience. To make matters worse, we saw the hair and the mouse after finishing eating. Had we seen it before gorging on food, we would have simply finished our wine and left. What an awful feeling to realize after ingesting an entire meal that your food was prepared in wholly unsanitary conditions - not to mention the kick in the face of shelling out $100+ after everything that happened. This was a completely unacceptable meal experience. Before this all happened, we discussed possibly going back and/or taking friends or family but we will NEVER step foot in there again. Disgusting. **SINCE WRITING THIS REVIEW, THE ALLEGHENY HEALTH DEPARTMENT DID AN INSPECTION: hdas01.achd.net/reports/... **Texas De Brazil corporate office have been unresponsive.

Q6q4talyFTJT8-F_V_5XxA.text: Terrible service, worst manager I've ever experience,.  This is the first negative review I've bothered to write on the net, several positive. Very expensive Ponderosa, if I could give it negative stars I would.

R2JaAT-QP8PWS3wvF9NR7A.text: This is the best I've ever been to. My family is from Brasil and absolutely loves this place! We are going again this week. The service is perfect as well! Deffinately recommend!!!

akeIkLHXiDrcBuSwziKuUQ.text: My husband and I had reservations for dinner at 7:00 to celebrate Valentine's Day and one of our last dinners together for awhile since we have a baby on the way in a few weeks and a five year old at home so these date nights don't come to often. We arrived at 6:45 and were not seated until 7:45, which I'm not upset about because I was expecting a long wait for a busy night. The restaurant was packed which is understandable for Valentine's Day weekend so when we were seated right beside the entrance and where everyone was gathered waited to be seated, mind you it was 4 degrees out that night, I asked if we could possibly wait for another table elsewhere. We were told "I assure you every table here is the same your food won't taste different elsewhere." So regretfully we sat there trying not to be a pain on such a busy night. Our whole dinner was interupred with people literally running right into our table or standing over top of us while they were waiting bumping into us the whole time or just staring at our every move, along with freezing when the door opened every few seconds. Our food was Cold bef ore it even made it into our mouths. We were told 6 times by different customers that they felt bad for where we were sitting. The food was good and our server was nice but finally having a night out and not even being able to hear eachother talk because of the large crowd next to us was very disappointing. It seemed like the servers only brought up the same 3 kinds of meat since we were in such a crowded hard to get area so when I asked for the bbq ribs on two different occasions they never came. I read on the review card to express your concerns before you leave the restaurant not in an email later so when I told the manager about our dinner he was distracted and simply said "sorry" and walked away. We paid the $120 For the nightmare dinner and went elsewhere to get dessert where we could be warm, hear eachother talk, and not be stared at the whole time. I then wrote an email to let them know about our experience since the manager did no seem concerned and my reply was that "for special occasions they rent extra tables and place them where they have room. We must of got one of those tables. Sorry about our experience and offered us 10% off our next meal." No thank you we will not be returning.

KB77YM9VXJfMFIalKPJnNg.text: A friend of ours took us to Texas de Brazil and we thought that the food was good, even though we had some filet that looked like a burnt offering to the gods. Something that our friend ate made her violently ill. She was unable to move from the table and was vomiting in a waste bucket that we were able to get to her in time. The manager came over at a loss, saying that he didn't know what to do in this situation. Our friend regains her composure and makes it to the bathroom and the server takes away the waste bucket but didn't have anyone mop up the floor which had vomit on it. When the check comes, our sick friend was still charged full price for a meal that made her ill. The situation was handled extremely poorly.

31QAmuND3NQRoIF4PY_GPg.text: Excellent. All the meats were fantastic & perfectly cooked. Salad bar had great variety. Service was very good, server was very nice. Really good authentic Brazilian drink selection as well as other drinks. Nice atmosphere, if you like meat you will like this place.

i9etMgFHHJOqQgqtiYS8Aw.text: My parents originally wanted to take me to Grand Concourse for my 16th birthday, but they had forgotten to get a reservation before hand. We had walked past Texas de Brazil and thought it looked fun so we went in and it was packed and smelled delicious. We got a table within 5 minutes despite how crowded it was.  It was such a fun experience!!! Having the traditional gauchos come up to the table and offer you food was the highlight of my night. If you are a meat lover (like I am) this is absolutely the place for you. I tried a lot of everything to be honest. My favorite was the filet mignon and the lamb. If I'm not mistaken, you pay about $40 for an all you can eat. I definitely ate well over $40 in meat. They also have a great "salad bar" that is so much more! Imported meats cheeses breads roasted veggies!  Also, I have a severe peanut allergy that we told the hostess about. She was very nice about it and the manager met us at the table and guided me around the salad bar pointing out what I could and couldn't eat. The whole experience was memorable and a great way to celebrate my birthday

yKSbWUwOu__mDS7r6feecQ.text: Had dinner at this place last night for Bryan's b-day and it was so good. To start with we brought the little man who I think was more excited about daddy's birthday then daddy was. When we arrived we were seated next to there wine cellar that is glassed in which created for the funniest moment of the night but ill get to that in a min. We started with the buffet which was very fresh but didn't have the largest selection which is ok with me because I would rather fill up on meat but I have to say I love beets with goat cheese and they had both so I was in heaven even before the steak. The meat for the most part was great. They prepaid it medium rare but will cook it however you like. As well if you find it to salty which I did not you can ask for it with no salt. The filet just melted in my mouth. This night they had top rib meat which I can't think of the technical name for but it was very fatty and after getting it on my plate I decided I would pass. I also have to compliment the meat guys they were all so good with my son as well as the rest of the wait staff. So many times while being out I've felt like restaurant staff have just dismissed him but I can't think of a single time when my son said something to a waiter or server that they didn't stop and acknowledge him. Now I will leave you with this. If siting by the glass wine seller keep your kids close because mine decided he wanted to check it out and ran right into the glass. Bryan and I laughed so hard. He didn't get hurt or anything and I don't think the table next to us even saw it but it was hilarious. This place is great for the whole family and the meat is amazing!!!!

Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

sbdGKyZ8wgrOwJgcapXuGw.text: Went last night with my financee (our 1st time), and we loved it.  The 'salad bar' was amazing.   So many great meats & cheeses.  And the meats were awesome.  Others have complained that it was too salty.  Of the 10 or so meats I tried, 1 (maybe 2) were salty, but I still liked `em. True, it is a bit pricey, but I was worth it.  Also, our service was great too!

A8bXPTTIO1LYdXPUeertFw.text: After anxiously awaiting a new brazilian churrascaria, Hubs and I made reservations at TDB for restaurant week. The special was their typical buffet and meats with a dessert option or 35$. It was actually a pretty good deal and ened up saving us $30 total. Upon walking in, I was blown away by he size of this place. Gigantic. It was also very busy as there was a late aftenoon private game that had just ended. I'm glad we made reservations seeing there was an hour and a half wait!  We were quickly seated and the server helped us pick out a glass of wine. We were given a small bread basket with round, cheesy bread balls and were instructed to help ourselves to the appetizer buffet. The buffet has a selection of prepared salads, some seafood, meats and cheeses as well as greens/veggies to make a salad. After a quick salad, I was ready for the good stuff-the meats! Our server brought over our wine as well as fresh plates, a side of fried bananas to cleanse the palate and mashed potatoes. We turned our coaster to green and anxiously waited . . . and waited . . . and waited. We saw several skewers of meat come out of the kitchen but then they retuned to the kitchen area empty without coming anywhere near our table. I'm not sure if they didn't realize that we were waiting or if it was tso busy that they didn't make it to our table before running out but we missed many tasty looking meats. Our server stopped by to ask how it was going noticing our plates were empty. I explained the situation and within two minutes, the meat was exiting the kitchen in the opposite direction and headed toward our table. We tried the filet, ribs, lamb chops, leg of lamb, skirt steak, sirloin steak, rotisserie chicken, chicken wraped in bacon, parmesan crusted pork loin (my favorite) and plenty more. We lost track after 12 different meats. After having our fill, we both chose the banana foster pie for dessert. It too was so tasty and delicious. We left our meal feeling very pleased with the overall experience. My only criticism is that our other favorite churrascaria  (Green Forest) has a better appetizer buffet with a bigger selection of seafood items.

Sh1ztUooj4QTbmKj2MxidQ.text: A meat lover's paradise. The meat is not as tasty as Chinese or Korean BBQ, which are cooked with more spices. But the meat it self is really good. Fresh and well grilled. The salad is just okay. A little expensive for me.

0fsG9G16nNprbqavcSr84Q.text: We've been here many times and you cannot go wrong with this place! Prepare for your meat to be cooked medium rare (when appropriate), be properly salted, and dripping with juices. If you have a group of picky eaters this is a definite crowd pleaser. Everything on the buffet is great, but I try to just go for the meat condiments and meat unless they have scalloped potatoes which are just so good. Service is perfect and you are often overwhelmed with food, but the whole environment is really fun. I wouldn't think that I would like a place with so much interaction (they bring the meat to your table and keep it coming), but I get excited anytime we are about to go. We do reserve for special occasions as it is pricey and ridiculously gluttonous. A meat splurge is best saved for a few times a year rather than a weekly hang out. ;)

HbEbVuAKrBe9jOQjUH6Flg.text: Ok. This is by far my favorite place to go eat. Make sure you go very hungry and having hours to eat as you will want to taste everything. The salad bar is fantastic but don't go crazy there as you will want to try all the meats they bring out. The service is spectacular   The bacon wrapped steak and he beef ribs are amazing. This is a must try place

49OnnmyNnP0T5QcIKlU5Vg.text: Best Restaurant in Pittsburgh. Always excellent service. That is why I continue to return. I tell everyone about this place. Five star service Five star food. Go today

bSQ8udMdqlumQmS4ogx3cg.text: I struggled with this review because although I really wanted to love my time here, I was just annoyed more than anything. Before I tell you about my time here I'd like everyone to be aware they sell 2 $50 gift cards at Costco for $80, $20 savings! So, We came with a group of 6 & had to wait about 15-20 to be seated although we had a reservation. The place is EXTREMELY loud and very hard to have a decent conversation. In my opinion the tables are way too close together. In our 2 hours there my purse fell off my chair from people walking passed about 5-6 times. As far as food goes however the meats were excellent. Almost all their meat is cooked at medium rare-medium but they did offer to bring anyone's meat back to be cooked more if they wished for no pink.  There is a wide array of sides and appetizers to go along with every meat. While I did not like my drink (Tito sunrise) my friends sangria was delicious! Def. recommend. Good food? Yes. Would I go back? Ehhh...def. not on a Saturday.

C5JIfmX1Kx2Dhs4KCDhT4A.text: Visiting Pittsburgh from Chicago to see the Bears beat up on the Steelers and to enjoy an incredible meal at Texas De Brazil. Entering the steak sanctuary I was telenovela by the incredible atmosphere and the positive energy of staff and patrons. The salad bar was well presented but lacked the selection of other Brazilian banquets I have been blessed to experience. I loved the hospitality of our server Eddie and his knowledge of the entire menu. Unfortunately things took a turn for the worse about halfway through our experience. The Gauchos turned into 'Gone'choes. I had to ask multiple times for our server and water guy to find some meat. Steelers fans at the table next to us are placing the magical green coasters on their forehead in an attempt to get someone, anyone's attention. After requesting our check, we had to wait nearly 30 mins. I really, really wish that they could have had the stamina to create a great experience from door to door. While there were good aspects of the experience, I struggle to give Texas De Bra'slow' more than two snail pace stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mbfBqIqdULmttTupFHbwJA.text: The service was spotty and marginal at best. We've eaten at a handful of these Brazilian steakhouses and usually the service is impeccable. This time was not the case. I had to yell at the gauchos to get them to serve us even though our 'chip' was turned over to green, and we had used plates piled up on our table without anybody coming to clear them.  The waitress seemed irritated when we had to ask for the side dishes to be brought over. I was disappointed.   We were looking forward to the restaurant opening. But won't be going back until they fix the poor service.

J3LW1Z6OBsQHY_GsAuwT9w.text: Technically, this should be no stars as it was so bad we didn't even make it to the food. My fiance and I went here tonight for a celebratory dinner. We were about 15 minutes early for our reservation and they weren't quite ready for us so we figured we'd grab a drink at the bar while we waited.   The bar was not very busy but it still took a surprising amount of time for the bartender to even acknowledge us. There were quite a few fruit flies buzzing around and when we finally ordered our drinks (both of which were from their cocktail menu - so things they SHOULD have had) I was told they didn't have the bourbon for the drink I ordered. Not a big deal as the bartender suggested a substitute, but it seemed like it was an inconvenience for her. She made my drink and part of my fiance's drink when she brought mine over and told my fiance that they were out of the lemonade for her drink. She then put mine down and walked away before we could order a different drink.  Eventually we did get a replacement drink order  but almost immediately noticed dead fruit flies in it. There were not only a few dead flies IN the drink, there were noticeable parts of flies floating ON it. When I pointed this out to the bartender she copped an attitude about it.  The drink had only had one sip taken from it so it's not like we were running a scam, but despite the large fly my fiance had fished out and dropped on a napkin the bartender still seemed fairly incredulous. The couple next to us wasn't having much luck either and at this point the meat they were bringing to the tables smelled odd and we just decided to leave (the table was also still not ready and we were now about 10 minutes past our reservation time). The bartender did eventually come back and made a big show of ripping up the old bill like she was doing us a favor by comping the one drink but really, rather than being proud of ripping up the old bill, she should have been embarrassed about serving a drink like that.  We left and told the hostess to go ahead and cancel the reservation on the way out. The hostess mentioned  that the table "wasn't that far behind schedule". We told her that wasn't why we were leaving and my fiance asked to speak to the manager. The hostess said the manager was unavailable as they were helping at the bar. We just laughed and left and will not be giving it a second try. If the bar is that dirty and generally bug infested, I can't imagine what the kitchen is like. No thank you!

s6hHOjMnOjRPDf0LvZIodw.text: I've been to the Texas De Brazil in Aruba several times so we were excited to see one open in Pittsburgh. In Aruba, the service is exceptional, but I always assumed it was because we were at a tourist destination. The service at the Pittsburgh restaurant was also really great, which was a wonderful surprise. The staff would ask us often if there were any meats we were looking to try and would make sure a server with that meat stopped by our table. They also gave us tips on what sauces from the salad bar worked well with the meats. Our server that refilled our water, took our dirty plates, and handled our check, however, was not very good. He barely checked on us and we went a good 20 minutes with empty water glasses and when you're eating a lot of salty meats, that water is a must! He also acted really put-off by the fact that we asked for a split check since we were dining with another couple, which I thought was strange.  The meats are usually rare to medium, but you can ask for well done. There's a good variety of beef, chicken, pork, lamb, and sausage. My favorites were the garlic medallion steak and the Parmesan pork. They also serve fried bananas and mashed potatoes as side dishes for each table. In aruba, they serve fried plantains, which we liked better, but I guess if you're in the US they opt for banana. It was still good though. You can't really go wrong with a banana fried in cinnamon and sugar.  The salad bar has a great variety and also serves non-salad bar items like sushi. If you go with a group, you can opt to get just the salad bar and no meat for a reduced price.   My biggest complaint with the Pittsburgh location is they crammed way too many tables into the dining room. You're bumping into people non stop. They really need to remove some of the tables so that people can move around better and not feel cramped.

WM7DK0tA0nWD3_xTqLTo6A.text: Unless you truly crave that mineral, I would avoid this place. Nearly all of the meat was far too salty, despite mostly being cooked well. We found ourselves desperately grabbing bowls of sliced pineapple (the only fruit at the salad bar) just to give our mouths some relief. At $50 per person, it's kind of crazy that we could only eat a small subsection of the food. :(

fweu4FZ-ssVRrJGVMHNgug.text: First visit was very good. The meat was everything I was hoping for. Everything else was wonderful. Salad bar and antipasto as good as any Italian restaurant. Mashed potatoes were great but be a carnivore and pace yourself through this meat lovers paradise. Try it out.  You'll be quite pleased.

nUFNclqnIDb39vpFgcPylg.text: Been going to TDB for about 6 years now. I can't get enough. One has now opened in Pittsburgh n its great. I used to not be able to decide which I liked better, Fogo or TDB but I must say TDB has won the battles my last few times comparing the two. The lamb chops are only one rib now but who cares. Get twice as many!  What's not to like? Yeah it's like 50 bucks a person but I like sushi and this is cheap compared to that. And I can eat lusciously cooked meat till I'm dizzy!  Its the American dream.  Update.  6-8-2014 I edited and deleted  a prior update in which my office staff and I were treated like shit at the front by the hostesses and female manager. Believe me I am overly polite. Anyway corporate apologized and after swearing I'd never go back to this tdb location (I've had nothing but fantastic experiences at all othe locations) I broke down to appease my protein addiction and came back.   The wait staff is awesome. The food is awesome. I stick to my guns tho. I don't care if they black list me when I go in....the dead beat hostesses and the female manager are about as friendly as dead fish.   Everything else is great!  I'll be back and I'll just ignore the greeters. If u can call them that.

wyO6IDRYRsXadD0Mg9rB0g.text: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed our meal there least evening,  Food and service very good.   As far as the 'too much salt' complaints I've read:  1. They tell you straight up when you are seated how the meats are prepared. 2. if you want you meats prepared without salt, that can be done. You tell your waiter. It will take more time to prepare. That's on you.   If you're looking for a quiet spot, this isn't the place to go. If you're into a bustling atmosphere, make the trip.   Plenty to choose from at the salad bar. I will probably skip this next time and concentrate on crushing meats.

EV1Fc1YB5KwvfFG67L-rPw.text: Meh this place was just ok. Had 7:45 reservations and didn't get seated until 8:05 even though place was half empty. The seating designed sucked. Food was above average tasting. Had the lobster bisque soup with no lobster in it. Overall this place is average.

oQ0kNBYh4Dmk6_fQiMfJRw.text: First time experience and it was good. I was highly impressed with there choices at the salad bar. So many choices and it was all very good. The meat choices were all good on an average. Some I didn't care for and some were good. The only choice that stood out for me was the garlic sirloin, which is odd for the cut of meat and what I usually prefer. This is my first experience at a Brazilian steakhouse so I have no comparisons, but the meat quality was average to good nothing special. I definitely will be bringing others back here every once in a while.  The only negative thing I can really say is the whole red/green card thing was a joke. They didn't follow that one bit and started asking us for meat as soon as we sat down eating our salads. it seemed like they ignored that and just brought us whatever meat based of the table next to us and what they were eating. It made it a little hard to enjoy when they showed up with 4 cuts of meat at once and nothing for 5  minutes. They could of done a better job a timing and spacing it out. It was like all or nothing it seemed. Overall that wouldn't prevent me from coming back.

UHsGKSUynDRvgCwWp2yqRg.text: Yummy! Make sure to come hungry! There is an all you can eat soup and salad bar, but don't fill up on that (I made that mistake). There are waiters walking all over the restaurant with different meat on skewers and they just cut it right then and there for you straight onto your plate. It's an all you can eat restaurant so pace yourself! When I was there, we had to wait at the bar for almost an hour to be seated, and this was with a reservation! Since we were seated so late, the restaurant emptied out a bit and a lot of the waiters with the skewers disappeared.. we had to ask our waiter multiple times to ask for more meat to come around. But then when it did, 3 /4 times it was bacon (and I don't eat bacon). Despite this, we filled up pretty quickly and so towards the end we didn't mind that the waiters weren't coming around anymore.

wlfTdtWD3qhcnsAXAEsNGg.text: I'm not easily impressed, but this place was spot on with everything. From start to finish, everything was exceptional. The salad bar to start had cheeses, smoked salmon, shrimp, tabouli, crusty bread, etc. all gourmet, nothing done on the cheap. Soup of the day, lobster bisque was the best I've had in a long time. (No chunks of lobster, yet superbly delicious) the Churrassco(skewers of meat) were hot off the grill, perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection. Service by Chris was exceptional and classy. Finished off with a perfect creme brulee. Lovely night and overall great experience!

EM73V1ifjyYbVT2ehHt3HQ.text: The first time I experienced Brazilian cuisine was in 2011 on a Royal Caribbean cruise.  It was a specialty restaurant and was worth every penny!!  The service was superb but being on a cruise, we assumed it was due to their experience.    For my birthday, my husband surprised me with Pittsburgh's Texas de Brazil and scored total bonus points!  We don't eat red meat and we let them know ahead of time... not one gaucho came over to our table with red meat - it was fantastic!  It was really busy too so they were good.    The salad bar was much more than expected, I could probably get enough from that only but I would NEVER pass up on the meat.  The lobster bisque is amazing and I can't say that I will ever have a bowl as good as this!  A manager came over to check on us but wasn't annoying, simply cared how our experience was.  We loved it so much we went back the next week and the place isn't cheap!  That's about $200 in two weeks to eat here.  I don't regret it.  I'd do it again.    Make reservations online because they do get busy and also join their birthday club - one free meal!

8kQIbWqn3BIODVNjLKsnDQ.text: Excellent salad bar, Cory our server was very attentive. The Parmesan crusted chicken was out of this world. Well well worth the money.  Order a bottle of reasonably priced Simi and your loving life.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

zC0rnA6NcR-ibECxQElAqw.text: Let me start by saying everyone was very friendly and the service was good. The food however was not very good. I guess I was expecting more since I have been to many other Brazilian steakhouses. The quality of the meat was just not there. My wife and I were also feeling nauseous later at night after our meal. It may or may not have been related to the food. I will never try another Texas de Brazil and recommend you don't either.

9zzLJSi9PyLThn1NlQ8OKA.text: Food was phenomenal. It was like a food adventurem. Staff was very  attentive and friendly. Managers are attentive and very visible. I've never had anything like it and it was delicious. They have chicken, beef, sausage and pork. Atmosphere is very appealing and beautiful . loved having dinner here !

IMX32TZzyAVhab8mlZML8g.text: The server we had was amazing. I had a bottle of Saratoga water and they would never let my glass get half empty. The food was amazing. The salad area had a lot of great things that you wouldn't find on a normal salad bar. The cinnamon bananas were so good. Of course, the meat was incredible. Eat every kind that they offer you and get seconds on both types of lamb. I highly recommend eating here. You will feel like royalty.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So much yums

3HGPcL7TN4lliYtPcJ5iuw.text: My friend got sick to her stomach right at the table about 20 minutes into dinner.  No attention from the staff for her discomfort and no discount on the check. Very disappointed.  We will not be back.

r0lyRlkPVaCdSR4iMTqqZg.text: Great service and really good food. Nothing to complain about except the obvious issue that if you are hearty eater then the $43 per person is reasonable--but if you eat light you won't feel like this even a reasonable value.  Every morsel was a treat and the salad bar was full of choices. Very allergy friendly.

b89DGSzceCU0rWgdvwaiNg.text: I read all of these reviews and almost talked myself out of Texas de Brazil. I am glad I made it. It was delicious, exciting, and exceeded my expectations.

W7lN39yjuMZzptxV5_q0_Q.text: I brought my boyfriend here for his birthday, and we enjoyed it so much that I brought my family back a month later.  I'm not a huge meat-eater, so I liked that they had a salad bar with a ton of options (I'm a cheese and veggie person so I loved everything I tried).  I still appreciated their meat selection...the picanha was my favorite!  The fried banana sides were refilled pretty quickly both visits, which was all that was really important to me, so I thought the service was great.  The only things that I didn't really like was that I had to navigate my way through a maze of tables to get to the salad bar, so coming back with plates of food made me a little nervous that I might drop something, and our table was a too cramped for 4 people, especially with so many sides going around.  I would still eat here again for sure though!

6a7v7soSY5QWXZQGaUqtfw.text: First time going here we ran into a red flag of a hostess but decided to give it a try since it was my first time there.  Numerous types of tender delicious meats and a few nice side options to add at the buffet area.  I suggest being smart and not totally starving yourself for this meal, but to have a light lunch so you can take advantage of the options and possibly gain 20 pounds.  Great atmosphere, food, and dessert.  So great we came back a few more times.

FxXIYTcmxTJwaIT7aGBX-A.text: Terrible brief experience. Restaurant was pretty empty. Music was blaring. Manager wasn't lowering it. Asked to see manager several times to no avail. While waiting for manager a mouse ran by several times.  We walked out and passed the manager on our way out. Can't imagine if it were busy. Also assumed that mouse was headed to the buffet!!!

HdtIR2ANvfwKEBH9uMX3wA.text: My boyfriend took me here for dinner to celebrate my birthday, and beforehand he had told me to not eat at all throughout the day so as to come extra hungry. I was glad I listened. Our server, Ryan was welcoming, knowledgeable, professional and friendly throughout our meal. In terms of the food, I was a great fan of the salad bar and was particularly fond of the various fresh cheeses and marinated shrimp. We got two sides with our meal; I especially enjoyed the garlic mashed potatoes which I was sad to not have the stomach to finish. The core of the dinner was the AYCE meat (various types - my favorites were the parmesan chicken, filet mignon wrapped in bacon, and sausage) which I had my doubts about initially because I personally am not a fan of red or pink meat, and they mentioned that they cook the meats to default medium to medium rare. However, the meats I did try that did not fall under those categories were amazing and had perfect texture and juiciness. My boyfriend ate so many meats, several times to the point where he was stuffed and then past the point of being stuffed, after which he continued to say yes because, as he told me, "it's just too good to say no to". We had no room for dessert but ordered the chocolate mousse cake to-go which was amazing as well.

7sV8Ic6mHq795rKxn9ASKA.text: Outstanding service Outstanding food just an amazing experience I really enjoyed myself if you haven't been here yet give it a try but go with an empty stomach cause there is plenty of food lots and lots of juicy meats and an amazing salad bar.

Gpx0DmJgi4ba-fPXM8Eanw.text: Expertly cooked meats and delicious sides. Nice variety of items at the salad bar and hot items bar. Do yourself a favor and grab a tiny bowl and get a delicious sauce or two to dip your meat in. (My favorite was the chimichuri with my steaks, and the roasted garlic on the warm bread). The sushi was surprisingly very good!  Not to be missed, the lobster bisque! Oh man....so delicious, and in a buffet environment no less! I've had a lot of lobster bisques, and this one is definitely tops! Also....au gratin potatoes. Try some, do it - maybe mix in some of that roasted garlic too!  Okay, so everyone goes here for the meats and I can definitely see why. They make it easy for newbies and you get a red/green sign to signal the servers to stop by, but really they were all asking regardless if it was red (pass for now). I was partial to the beef cuts, but the chicken and sausages were acceptable. After a few bites of sausage, the salty factor caught up to me and it was no longer enjoyable. If dining with others, perhaps split a portion your served, that way you can sample more and decide what tastes best for you. My husband I used this method and we were able to sample almost everything we wanted, and then some.  Worth the hype, and at the price I could not have asked for better cooked steak. You definitely get what you pay for. Utilize the reservation feature on their website!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

F6E6neWa71eBQcs_KV9goQ.text: We have been going to Texas de Brazil since it opened at Station Square in Pittsburgh. It was always our go-to restaurant for birthdays, celebrations & Mother's Day. We've always had fantastic service, the food was hot & delicious with a lot of variety & the overall experience was always wonderful.   This time, we went on Mother's Day & it was quite possibly one of the worst dining experiences I've had in years. We had a reservation for a specific time & they left us (including my elderly mother) standing at the hostess station for over 25 minutes. They weren't updating us with how soon our table would be ready & when I would ask them, they acted like they were doing me a favor. All 3 front desk employees were rude & none of them had a smile on their faces. When they seated us 25 minutes late, there was no apology for the wait and no explanation.  Once we were seated, it took a very long time for the server to take our order. She was nice'ish (when we actually saw her), but she did not pay much attention to us because we weren't a large party. My son's drink was empty for about 15 minutes, and we kept trying to get her attention for a new drink, and no, it wasn't a free refill type of beverage. She was at the table right next to us twice and didn't even look up or over at us. We did not feel like valued guests at all.    The cheese biscuits, one of our favorite things, were cold & hard as rocks & the selection of meats was minimal. We are used to having at least 10 different types of meats, and this time, we were offered maybe 4.   We still tipped our server more than 20% because, coming from the hospitality industry, I know how challenging a holiday can be.
