However, her service left a lot to be desired & frankly, I don't think I saw her smile even once. It actually seemed like almost every employee was miserable, unhappy & hated their jobs. The only exception was the men who came around with the meats. They were friendly, professional & seemed happy.   I'm really disappointed in the downward turn this restaurant has taken because we absolutely used to love it. I hope management can shake things up & bring this restaurant back to what it used to be. There is absolutely no reason we should have had this terrible of an experience. We are not hard to please & always give the benefit of the doubt. There was so much room for improvement, and we were really disappointed. We will not return until we've heard improvements have been made. And I plan on sharing with my friends who like to go there as well on special occasions that our experience was awful.

G_-8ClXw3C4RnP1tUvc9ew.text: Thanks to our son,  we had a gift card and it was restaurant week.  $35.19 for dinner with desserts. Awesome server Don or Donald best server we've had since they opened. Everything was perfect.

jSGjL9KmutnR8kzocLfL9Q.text: Stopped by here for my graduation dinner this weekend (Hail to Pitt!). I had a reservation for 4:30 PM for a party of 7 people.  We get to the restaurant and we had to wait 15 minutes before being seated. What is the point of making a reservation if I'm not going to be seated right away? I'm usually a pretty patient person but I made an early reservation because we had to get to my graduation. I felt like I was in the Seinfeld episode where he makes a reservation for a rental car and when he gets there, they don't have any cars left for him. And he said exactly what I said, "That's why you make a reservation. What is the point of making a reservation if it's not going to be ready for when you arrive?"  Our server Alina was doing the best that she could for us. It was pretty busy, but she was really knowledgeable and a great server. It's not her fault that the bread isn't ready. But everyone was just really behind! Even the meat people hardly came around initially, maybe once or twice within the first 30 minutes of our arrival. We saw meat people going to tables nearby us but never in our section; we weren't the only table having this issue. Our bread didn't come until half way through our meal, along with the mashed potatoes. Our water cups were almost always empty. Service and meat picked up towards the end of our meal, but by that time we were already full from the cold bar and we also needed to leave if I wanted to get to my graduation on time.  The food was delicious but the service honestly sucked. And a place this freaking expensive should have both good food AND good service. It was really irritating knowing that my family asked to go somewhere nice for graduation and they paid so much money for such annoyingly slow service.  Overall for the price, it was a really disappointing evening and experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Gkke0UJvLx5HX7a267d9Zw.text: Terrible. Commercial. Dirty.   They literally gave us a seat pretty much INSIDE of the kitchen. Then when we politely asked if we could please move because it made my husband and children uncomfortable, they put us next to the restrooms  0/10 would recommend. Please do not waste your time here. Keep scrolling fellow diners.

xFCWEayY9enZwOHqT2oGDw.text: The atmosphere is inviting but noisy. The salad bar/ food bar area was excellent. There are many choices to choose from, there was one soup which was good. Our waitress was superb. The drawback came when you are waiting for the servers with the meat. We waited at least 5-10 minutes if not longer for a meat server. Most of the beef was fatty. I requested chicken which came around later and was wrapped in bacon. That's good if you like bacon. Honestly, I will not hurry back.

X_Imq-zDNqtZEx9tCocFqg.text: Went here on my birthday in April ( on a Wednesday ) had a wonderful experience . Manager stopped at our table to talk and the waitress was great . Decided to take my step daughter here for her birthday . My husband called to reserve a table . Whomever answered the phone was rude and impatient . Told my husband since it was a Saturday and we wanted to reserve at 6 pm to just come in . They would not reserve. And the wait could be until 9 pm! So we drove over . At the hostess booth there were three women . I asked them if we could be seated , they declined, I looked around and saw several open tables but they insisted there was a waiting list we needed to get on and the wait was a hour or more .  Don't get me wrong .. the food IS good . I just assumed since I had such a wonderful experience on my birthday , that my stepdaughter would have one as well . We went to dine elsewhere . Wish the staff could be more accommodating . Considering the amount of money we leave here ( AND we're GREAT tippers!)

hcBIxsKQDyhhUNh20MTtsg.text: This place has definitely gone downhill, which is surprising to me. My family and I came here for dinner last night. We made a reservation, which was recommended and we still had to wait for our table. I wasn't sure why we had to wait because there were plenty of open tables around the restaurant. Once we were seated, our waiter came over to take our drink order. Our table of 5 all ordered waters and you could see on his face that he was annoyed that we didn't order any soft drinks or alcohol. I honestly made me feel weird that he reacted like that.   Anyways, the salad bar was well stocked, so that's a plus. However they don't have nearly as much variety as other Brazilian restaurants around the city.   Another flaw of the evening was how infrequent the waiters came around offering meat options. When they did come around, it was almost always the same 3 things.   Our waiter hardly ever came back to check on us or refill our glasses during dinner. However, when it was time to pay, be picked up our check very quick.   I've been to Texas de Brazil plenty of times before, but something was definitely off last night. The only reason I would come back here would be for the lamb chops- they literally are out of this world amazing - but very hard to track them down throughout your meal.

lrBKIsFyPkM9BulEtKzVkA.text: My husband and I had- by far- the worst dinner experience in a VERY long time, possibly ever, tonight. We went to Texas de Brazil in Pittsburgh. The food was great but the waiters to bring the meat to your plate kept skipping our table. We kept flagging people down to try to get them to come to our table, our waitress that did our drinks and whatnot kept flagging them down and the still kept skipping us. Our check was $90 (after a coupon was used) and we left still hungry because we couldn't get food to our table. It was absolutely ridiculous. I've had better service from Bob Evans or McDonald's even! Will take something very big to get us to go back.

eFC2KEfWQncRsgJNKntrGQ.text: I visited for a friend's birthday during restaurant week. This was my second time coming to a Brazilian steakhouse, so I knew what to expect. The salad bar was quite good and the selection was great. I really liked their sushi, the scalloped potatoes, and their rice and beans. The meat was good as well, however nothing blew me away. One piece of meat was so chewy and did not break down at all, so I literally could not swallow it. The employees who were bringing the meat around didn't give you any options in terms of cooking preferences (rare, medium rare, etc.) which surprised me as I did have this option at the other steakhouse I visited. We had a large party and the server did a great job with keeping up with the drink orders, and bringing us all of our desserts (which was part of the restaurant week deal). The dessert was ok- I had the key lime pie, which was decent, but nothing to write home about. There was one thing that seemed to upset a lot of people at our table and something that should be noted for future guests. Since it was restaurant week, the meal was cheaper than it normally would be and also came with a dessert. A lot of the guests at our table brought gift cards to pay for their meal- some of which were from Costco and Sam's Club (the white gift cards). I also had a gift card, but mine was a black gift card (purchased at Giant Eagle). The server notified us when we asked for our bills that they could not accept the white gift cards, as those cannot be combined with any other discount. The black gift cards were acceptable to use. This upset a lot of people at our table, because there was no signage posted about this and no one had notified them until the end of their meal. Had they had known about this before, they wouldn't have ordered the dessert, since they had to pay for that out of pocket in order to use their gift cards. They had used these gift cards many times prior at this restaurant, and did not realize that restaurant week would change anything.   Overall, our meal was ok, but I wouldn't come back and pay full price. Perhaps my experience wasn't so ideal because it was restaurant week and busier than normal, which I can understand, but I'm still not sure if I will run back here any time soon.

iWPxY_C0bj74f9weGxp8hQ.text: Made a reservation for 2 for my boyfriend's birthday on Monday, and I was definitely impressed by the food and the service.  For dinner you have two options-- the full dinner or the salad bar only. I wouldn't recommend skipping the meat, but you can absolutely have a good meal at the salad bar. It has plenty of options-- including some seafood-- and everything tasted great.  There was a wide variety of meat, and it was fun to sample a little bit of everything. The bacon-wrapped filet was amazing, and so was the sausage.  My boyfriend has a peanut/tree nut allergy, and we were offered our choice of a couple different complimentary dessert options that he could eat safely (flan, creme brulee).

8McqVyeRFWWIsNgodq2UwA.text: Meh, is about the correct term for this.  We went on Sunday for lunch. It was underwhelming. The salad bar didn't have a good selection. There was no labels on any of the dishes, so you couldn't tell what was what. Also, we sat at the other side of the room from the kitchen and barely got any of the meats. We finally had to ask our waiter if we could try a few things since it never came to our side. The meat needed more seasoning. When they did come to our table it was the same things.  It was not worth the money. Now, I know.

ifFcD0_d7LFePkKq7n--XA.text: I've always heard the term "meat sweats" but never actually experienced it and understood the feeling until I ate at Texas de Brazil. If you enjoy eating meat, this place is your dream come True!  As long as you have your coaster flipped to green, the meat just keeps coming to you! They have a large variety to choose from. From various cuts of steak, sausage, pork, chicken, and ribs.   The salad bar is a trap. There are so many delicious options on the salad bar! I think they are trying to get you to eat as much as possible from the salad bar so you eat less meat. But hey it's a good strategy!  My personal favorites are the house picanha and the lamb! The flavor is perfect and it is very juicy! I also really enjoyed the bananas that they bring out to your table. I can never get enough of those!  If you leave hungry, it's definitely your fault!

E2PbILzYmW6LvqiHAR0g_g.text: Meat? Unlimited you say? Brb making a reservation now..  This was my second visit at Texas de Brazil. I could write a run down of all the meats I tried but that'd be a bit overboard. It was super busy on the Friday night I visited, on top of that it was also Restaurant Week ($35, regularly $45).  FOOD: Ugh so delicious. Salad/sides bar was solid too. I always stock up on the asparagus and some greens to make me feel better about eating a village's worth of beef. Filet mignon and top sirloins were solid. I'd like to say that the BBQ brisket was not so great and the sauce was overpoweringly sweet (I'm a Kansas City girl, I just couldn't say no to trying BBQ in the Burgh). After awhile even though the flavor is good, you get sick of eating beef after two hours (yes we sat there for almost two hours, oops). Had to pass on dessert as I was slowly slipping into a food coma in my seat. My first visit I did get creme brulee, and it tasted awfully "egg-y", not representative of a good creme brulee :(.   SERVICE: At first, it was slow as the beef took awhile to come out as I sat there with my little indicator on green impatiently waiting to feed my red meat addiction. They would come out with sausages or chicken, but my eyes and heart were set on some top sirloin and filet mignons. We were seated in a spot where they would usually come to us first out of the kitchen, and while you might think that's a great thing, my boyfriend commented on how we got the kind of burnt/too crispy outsides of meat.   I smell like beef..

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. creme brulee and banana foster

69OewDaT2inunTdtNJaYGQ.text: Quality of the food is not the case. On this visit to the Pittsburgh establishment service was so horrible. I went with a group of 12 you would think they would try to serve us meat right well this was not the case we had a reservation for 9pm place was busy as it should be it a good establishment. We sat at the restaurant for about 1 hour and 45 minutes and they came to our table to offer stakes 3 times in that span. It was just horrible the wait we have been there times that the establishment has been super busy and never have these types of issues.

8eQxVFooPLNMbmm_2WwUXA.text: The food was bad it suck the servers were mean giving me dirty looks if I had to compare to fogo de chao or Texas de Brazil I would chose fogo de chao

rd0L7sGokhf-mGtT8O84Ew.text: Phenomenal service, lovely waitress, yummy food and great atmosphere! The location is also very convenient specially if you are staying at Sheraton hotel!  The gentlemen who serve the food are also very very welcoming and the hospitality is top the roof!

aEfutHUwztFnn9TyLZieRA.text: This is probably one the most unique dining experiences ever! Lexy is and amazing waiter as well as an amazing bartender! Chefs are continuously coming around with world class meat on kababs. Great buffet bar. All around great dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lovely experience!

ftKv5nLPJT5x8rFrGtp6sA.text: I love Texas de Brazil! Its one of my absolute favorite places to eat! It has an awesome salad bar and any pescatarian would be able to enjoy themself there as well. I always bring friends from out of town to this place. The only thing I will say is I don't recommend buying the VIP card until they have a better process. Its currently a paper card (and I lose things way too often) and you can't really ever use it when you want to. but overall its definitely a go to restaurant for any occasion!

I6aOo-kGSw32MFza4-N7Xg.text: This was an epic meal. If you like meat then this is a must visit resturant. I don't say this often but everything was amazing. Every cut was tender and perfectly seasoned. There is not one menu item I would criticize. The salad bar that was included provided perfect accompaniments  for the cuts of meat. Balsamic onions, roasted garlic cloves, and a nice selection of cheeses just to name a few, enhanced the flavors of the meat. While potatoes, beans and rice provided the starch component. I had heard bad things about the speed of the servers and the quality of the service. I want to say my experience was the exact opposite. My server? Awesomeness! The speed of the carvers was great. I found myself turning over my card to red something I never did at the smaller Green Forrest resturant. They also would prepare the cuts to order . I can not wait to go back.

bpEL19bRgVvJ-T9GUO75YA.text: Went here for a dinner out with husband, brother in law and his girlfriend. We had our 4 month old with us and they were wonderful with accommodating her car seat.  We had a decent bottle of wine and the food decent. Great salad and side bar and meat on skews. What more can someone ask for? My only dislike is it cost over $100 for 4 of us. We will go again but this is a very special occasion type place for us.

d2B962GypaXuSNgykP_5hg.text: I'm not a meat-lover, and I never have a bad meal here.  They have a beautiful salad bar and small buffet that more than satisfies my appetite while my husband indulges in a carnivore's dream.  Don't miss out on the lobster bisque on the buffet, and the cheesy rolls on the table are a real indulgence.  It's pricey, but great for a special occasion.  We look forward to bringing my dad here!

sfm85Ka3ZdHoGeDKtC01Uw.text: Insanely over priced salty meat that made me beyond sick. I've never been so ill from a meal in my life. It was $64 for buffet, dinner, one glass of wine and tip. No thanks.

7L3tYbElLckSQRiBGg5AMA.text: Great food. Excellent food.  The service, though very nice was INCREDIBLY...EPICALLY slow. Felt like we were getting hungry again waiting for the check.

fuEyayI0aStUuEqPXRdrrQ.text: The restaurant is clean. My husband and I went in on a Monday night, the place was pretty much empty but the service was still pretty slow.   I was a little disappointed at the selections from the salad bar. I guess my expectations was a little too high. I have seen more stuff at other Brazilian steakhouses.   The meat tasted good for the most part.  However, we wish that the meat servers would stop asking us if we needed more meat. We both had our little meat sign flipped over to the red side, but the meat servers still came over and asked all the time. The sign on the table basically meant nothing to them. What's the point of having it?

PyBiRP5WoiN7MvYVvLORmA.text: This is a fun place to eat, although it does not have as many authentic Brazilian dishes as Green Forest.  The price seems reasonable, given the amount of food.  They made a big deal out of telling us to turn over the medallion to the red side if you did not want additional meat brought to your table, however they kept bringing the meat anyway.  It's just a had place to have serious or quiet conversation, there are a lot of interruptions.  I loved the marvelous cheeses on the salad bar.  The meat was cooked perfectly.

0bP166KOW05TstL1GdKLmA.text: It doesn't compare to Green Forest.  No free refills on soda is probably my biggest pet peeve in the restaurant business. You ask for a coke, and they bring you a tiny bottle. When I pay this amount of money, I expect certain things. Free refills is one of them.  The food. It wasn't wonderful. Most of it was over cooked. Every slice we got was medium well, grey, and not at all juicy. Our waitress seemed like she was bothered when I asked her to have certain cuts of meat come back around. I wouldn't of had to ask her that, if the staff that carried the meat wouldn't of skipped our table most of the time.  It was happy hour when I went. They had a sign outside of the restaurant telling me so. So when I asked for a drink, the waitress said, "sorry thats only at the bar". I said ok, can I go get a drink at the bar and bring it back here? She said no. I mean really?!   The Green Forest was a much better experience. It had more cuts of meat, at a better cook temp. They offer free refills on soda, the wait staff was much better at the Green Forest too.    Don't believe the hype. Go to Green Forest, you will be happier

kTErpwB0raExeW5JwoL3rg.text: Meat was delicious and cooked very well. Salad bar is extensive and much more than just a salad bar. Most light eaters would be very content with just the salad bar. Probably ate about five pounds of meat, delicious. Only complaint was that they really slowed the rate they brought the meat to our table because we were eating a large amount. However, overwhelmingly positive experience! 10/10 would go again

JSkIiE77e2Po9S7okROtJA.text: Celiacs beware! The service was great and our server was excellent. I was very impressed that when I told my server that I cannot eat anything with gluten (I am a person suffering from celiac) he really tried to point out the foods that contain gluten etc. I and my daughter got a major dose of gluten, anyway. Perhaps it was cross contamination. Too bad! Food was good, too!

OZPgjMHena3zhtpwtn0n-Q.text: This was our first time at Texas de Brazil, we were a bit hesitant. When we arrived , we were  greeted at the door by name. The best service ever. We felt so welcomed and comfortable. Its a very classy place. Amazing salad bar with a good selection of cheese.    The meat kept coming and coming. The lamb was my favorite, it was cooked just the way I asked for it. The manager stop by and asked if everything was ok and if we needed a special cut, very nice. Our server was amazing. There's also a huge selection of wine. The price was just right. We will definitely be back, it was a very nice experience. I loved it.

DwopTeGD-d-scd9suy3znA.text: The salad bar is fantastic but the meats are even better. The flank steak is not something I would normally order but it was unbelievably delicious. The lamb chops were perfect. All the meat was cooked perfectly at medium rare. My husband had a few pieces which were a little less than medium rare and he loved it. We were so full, we only ate a few bites of the carrot cake for dessert but it was the best we ever had.  Our server Ashley was attentive, helpful and very sweet.   Overall, it was a fabulous dinner and we will definitely return.

1-eRA8Xm2QlWmsIuWw3kKQ.text: Everything was amazing.    The salad bar had a wide variety of brazilian style vegetables,  shrimp, salmon and lobster bisque.  Atfter tasting it I thought I would want to just keepeating from it. I was wrong once I tasted the meat. Everything was seasoned and cooked well.  The servers kept our plates stacked and wetter all very nice.  Once they notice we slowed done they asked what we wanted and I was able to end with a plate of filet mignon.  Great night.

lqqNhYOSOKT1mKRj7OOWYQ.text: This is our go-to restaurant for special events.  The beef selections are unbelievable!  My favorite was the flank steak - the seasonings were perfect.  The salad bar is so impressive with hundreds of selections.  Good desserts too!

RzWicv0gHnW2bvYM7ZsovQ.text: This is a great Brazilian steakhouse option for Pittsburgh. If you have never been to a Brazilian steakhouse before and you don't mind spending around $80-$100 for two people, I highly recommend that you try this place.

rmueI8g1898KLV5Ybvqiew.text: This is not my favorite Brazilian steakhouse, but it's a Brazilian steakhouse so it's pretty good. The price is standard around $45 per person. It includes all the meat you can eat and a salad bar. Atmosphere is decent tho it can get loud. The waitstaff is friendly and most of all the meat is delicious.  My only complaint about the set up is the salad bar, it's very tight two people cant fit side by side so it's a bit tricky to get your cheese and salads. That's not a terrible thing though as you should concentrate on the meat anyway it what you paid for.   The meat is always on the rarer side but that's standard for these types of restaurants... You can ask for meat more well done and they will accomidate you

Tn0km5cvEAitVQ_u-34lkg.text: Outstanding! I've eaten at several of the other locations, and I'm happy to welcome them to Pittsburgh. They have only been open a week.  I went with my niece (who has never been before), her husband (who has been to several locations, as well) and their sons.  Everyone had a good time. The Boys were in heaven.   They have done a great job with this location. The service was outstanding. We were taken care of without feeling smothered. The flow of the meat and the knowledge of the servers was great. They took time to explain what they were serving and finding out the favorites.  Our main waiter, Jonathon, was attentive and friendly. He took time to make the 'newbies' feel welcome.   The salad bar is worth the price of admission, but the different meats is the reason we all come.  They were all prepared perfectly.  The Boys loved anything wrapped in bacon (and who can blame them).  Even dessert was amazing - save room for the Bananas Foster Pie.   Can't wait to go back.

HKhWpHU1oMhEKTvgjPPoqQ.text: I'm torn on how to review this restaurant. Given the lack of choices in da Burgh for Brazilian steakhouses, I might rate it 3 stars. Compared to other Texas de Brazil locations I have tried, this restaurant rates 1 star. Over all, I decided to average it out at 2. It isn't at all bad, but it should be much better.  Other reviews have covered the experience so I'll stick to what didn't work, and then mention the things that did.  The salad bar is nice, but not half the size of what is normally offered at a Texas de Brazil. I will sometimes opt for just the salad bar, but this one doesn't have the selection. Usually I would tell vegetarians they could eat here and be happy, I'm not sure I would recommend this location.  Meat is the star of the show. It was sadly lacking here. The meat we got was good, but they had maybe half as many gauchos as normal. The experience is supposed to be like a meat parade - the meat comes in so many cuts and options, and so fast, that you can't keep up, and very quickly have to flip your card over to say you've had enough, at least for now. Here that never happened. The meats came around so infrequently we nearly always sat with an empty plate before the next gaucho came around.   Of the advertised cuts of meat, we saw just about half in the time we were there. Usually picanha is rotated through frequently, but here it came by only twice. Flank and leg of lamb came by once. We were offered filet, chicken, and sausage many times.  Also, at the beginning they ask if there is any specific cut you like, and we said beef ribs, which is our favorite. When we were ready to leave, they still had not come out so we asked again. They did come out, but the meat was dried out and not very appetizing.   High points were my caipirinha, the lobster bisque, and I'll give them bonus points for the fact three different people asked us if we liked our table or if we would like to move.   The experience was summed up by my boyfriend asking at the end of the meal if I could take him someplace else for his birthday, since this wasn't quite what he was hoping for.

c9U218pUTPHzmhvXIzIsPA.text: Very Good. All you can eat.  Meat of all kinds and lots of it. Cooked anyway you like it. Salad bar was also Great.  Service was also great.  If your a meat eater this place is a must when in Pittsburg. It is Zuverman approved.

H1sL0SSIn0mQw4dpo3MfHQ.text: Had a excellent dinner with friends Friday night , service was excellent, salad bar was amazing, and the food was outstanding. Looking forward to our next trip.

ensGiv9yRRiJcv8M_AVckQ.text: My favorite restaurant of all time is "Green Forest". So I was slightly disappointed when I came to Texas de Brazil. Although Texas de Brazil did somethings better than Green forest.  First I wanted to talk about what I did like. I liked the table, I liked my waitress, and the restaurant has a great salad bar. I think the salad bar was genius; they have dishes that someone wouldn't typically get. This is to reel you in to what else your about to eat.   Then Texas de Brazil does a slight left ...then a detour through average city. This is where it loses a star for me, as Green Forest has a bigger selection and the meat taste better. This is to be expected as this is a branch. But I felt like there was only 5-6 meats going around.  This place got a seal of approval. Probably a better place to start out and try Brazilian food. But Green Forest wins by a landslide.

ToE5p8UcsLmfBSBFiI660g.text: I recently had my first Texas De Brazil experience.  To start, they're located in station square, so they have an awesome view of the river and city right next to the restaurant. There's benches everywhere so you can sit, relax and enjoy the fresh... smell of Joe's crab shack nearby (not complaining). There is also a fountain in this area but it wasnt turned on.   We made a reservation for 5 through google. We arrived went in 5mn before and was seated immediately. They were extremely busy for an early Sunday evening.   The food was great, the servers were all awesome, and the overall experience was well worth the price.   The reason for the -1 star is because they have a salad bar but I was unable to find things to put on the salad (i.e. tomatoes, cheese, carrots, cucumbers, etc). I'm not sure if I overlooked it, but I walked around the salad bar a few times before settling on a salad with only ranch and a plate of a variety of sides they had available.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

PHtBEdnXFgS5bhlCJZymzA.text: I tried again.  Again, Texas de Brazil failed.  A couple of my co-workers and I wanted to try Texas de Brazil for restaurant week - so reservations were made.  The day of the reservation, i got a call confirming the reservation, asking if we were celebrating anything, etc.  I confirmed that we were coming for restaurant week - but that was all.  Once we arrived, we confirmed - again that we were there for restaurant week, once seated - we again, confirmed to our waiter that we were there for restaurant week.  We were sitting in dreadful seats.  For an hour - all that came to our table was the same pork 4 times and the same chicken dish - 3 times.  We had alerted our waiter.  We even tried to flag down the RED meat.  I get that they potentially have sections that they cover.  Maybe our section isn't in a specified section.  We - on purpose - finally sat with empty plates and timers going on our phones.  It was comical at that point.    20 minutes after we had notified our waiter that we had only been getting pork and chicken, someone came by with a different meat.  Yipee!  Then - another 20 minutes went by before we could get another sword of food.    While we didn't get the food we wanted, we were ready to leave.  Our bills came.  I have dined at Texas de Brazil for restaurant week multiple times.  I have never had to notify my waiter that I am there for restaurant week to get the restaurant week pricing.  So imagine our surprise when our bills were regular pricing!  Once we found our waiter again, told him of the error - he came back threw the bills on our table.  Not just nicely set them down - threw.    It was yet again not a good experience.  I want to enjoy Texas de Brazil...but it seems to just...I don't know - disappoint.

GmhjoFyaC3k1CgmY9U-lDw.text: It was the first time we tried Texas de Brazil and it was a great experience! The salad bar has sooo many options, not only salads. There are different types of cheese, sausages, fish, spreads and they where all dellicious. The meat was great too. We tried less types because we don't eat pork. Our waiter Donald was very professional and nice. Oh and the FRIED BANANAS were soo good. As you sit down waiting for the meat to be prepared you can go ahead and take whatever you want from the salad bar, but if you are not a big steak fan you cand just eat from the salad bar and you also pay less.  They are going to explain everything when you enter the restaurant. Try it you will not regret it! P.s a little tip: desserts are brought to you at the end of the dinner, they are not included in the menu price. We where full but got them to go not knowing they are extra. They are ok, not great.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WXfl4tYnZZhyJwb0XwJGNQ.text: This is a fun place to go for a celebration! We came here for my boyfriend's birthday. He had never been to a Brazilian steakhouse before so I knew he was in for a treat.   We made a reservation and were sat promptly. I think it is good that we decided to make a reservation, because even though it was a Monday, it was still fairly busy inside for some reason. Our waitress greeted us promptly. I don't think we got a great explanation (hard to hear, and clearly rushed), so thankfully I had eaten at one before and could walk him through what to do to supplement. She recommended a wine to us, which we decided to try. It was newly imported from California, and delicious! We ended up getting another bottle.   We started with the salad bar, which is way better than any other salad bar you've ever seen. So many different choices... I think we went a little crazy at first piling everything on our plate! From soup, fish, salad ingredients, sides, etc, it had so much!  Once we sat down, the wine was brought over and we began our dinner. There are people who walk around with meat on skewers and approach your table and ask if you want what they have. You can always say no. We found that often times the meat we actually wanted (shrimp, sirolins, etc) tended to not get to our tables. Thankfully, when our server came back, she hunted down someone with the shrimp and he was able to bring us more.   Everything was delicious! Great experience. Definitely come prepared to drop some $$$

kYRcI7orEy65Ka4d8omeWQ.text: I would argue that this is my favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh. Yeah, it's a chain in some respects but you certainly get the meat sweats and a tremendous opportunity eating as much as you humanly can.   I am a huge fan of goat cheese and apply it to their meat as it comes. All in all, I would advise going on a date night with the spouse, or perhaps a special occasion but you'll find that lots odd dressed individuals find their way into the $50 a plate restaurant. We had a blast, and certainly will go as much as our babysitter permits. 8.5/10

vNfSYfHByN-cFlfLxRWIfQ.text: This place is amazing! Staff is friendly and attentive. Parking kind of stinks but if you go early there should be no problem. It's definitely pricey but loved all the different meats!

JZNje3PtySVIdZ-r8O1kFg.text: A great place to splurge! The cold salad bar is one of a kind and upscale with lots of unique items like hearts of palm, crunchy fresh bacon, shrimp , potato salad (my fav) etc. There is a warm bar as well with THE BEST scalloped potatoes, mushrooms, and lobster bisque soup I have ever had. And the best part is getting the meat sweats from the huge variety they have. They gave a nice selection of white and red meats and even had grilled shrimp.  If you want your meat prepared differently they can accommodate.   They sale gift cards at Costco for a good deal.  Check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Garlic Mashed Potatoes and Sweet Fried Bananas that are complimentary with your purchase.
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The beautiful upscale salad bar
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My salad bar plate

vre4OqwCd241vWjVvP6vMQ.text: We had a fantastic waitress and the food was perfect.  Everything was good.  The leg of lamb was perfect and the Brazilian steak was flavored and cooked perfectly.  Even my wife who hates any fat or pink in her steak found the food to be great and we both thoroughly enjoyed our meal.

Z290QKXLn58YyEFLw-Jvxg.text: Ate here for restaurant week so it was a bit cheaper! And we came with ten people!!! Oh my gosh. This place never disappoints. Unreal. Spicy sirloin is my new favorite I think. I'm obsessed! Plus do NOT leave this place without getting the cheesy potatoes from the salad bar area. You will not regret it, I promise. Don't fill up on the salad area. But definitely get those potatoes. I'm dreaming of them right now actually.......

KjZdZ7JJldN9PgobYAqOkw.text: My friends and I recently treated ourselves to a night out, and it was an experience, to say the least. We arrived approximately 20 minutes earlier than I our 5pm reservation, therefore we were seated at the bar to wait. Conveniently, happy hour had already begun so we enjoyed $5 cocktails while waiting. I personally indulged in the Rio Sunrise which I ordered again later in the night before happy hour concluded.   When we first arrived, the place was almost completely empty except for a couple seated at the bar. Initially, it didn't make sense why we couldn't be seated our table with so every table open, but once dinner began, it suddenly made sense.   At 5pm, we were taken to our table where we were able to stretch out and get comfortable. Our server promptly asked if anyone had been here before to which we all replied: no. He explained how everything worked and welcomed us to the salad bar. His explanation of everything got us even more excited for what was to come.   We made our way through the salad bar which was full of pleasantries including spanish cheese, sushi, lobster bisque, and so much more. I tried to get small portions of everything knowing all that all that meat would be coming soon in addition to fried plantain and mashed potatoes. I enjoyed mostly everything I got from the salad bar including the lobster bisque. It had nice flavor, but I also expected it to be thicker.   Then the meats came and kept on coming! One after the other: sausages, porks, steaks, chickens--you name it. The servers were very  patient in waiting to see who actually wanted their selection off the 2ft skewer. They took survey and then made their way around our table. They would either drop the meat onto our plates or instruct us to grab our personal tongs.   I quickly had a few favorites including the spicy sirloin and lamb. Lamb ended up being a table favorite. Our server had the lamb and spicy sirloin sent back to our table after the first couple rounds. After awhile, I had to turn my little card over to red so that I could eat what was in front me. Know that if you're like me and you like your meat well done, you can just let each of the servers know. Ever so often, I'd use the fried plantain to cleanse my palate. Not really; that's what it was for but it was also just so delicious!   After we we just about full and our table mostly cleared. Our server brings over a tray full of cake and pie slices. Game Over! You're never too full for dessert! I had the carrot cake and regretted nothing!   I don't think I've ever left a restaurant so full and satisfied not only with the food but also the service. We all had agreed that our only 'good' service in comparison to 'excellent' service was the hostess. Everyone else more than made up for them with their smiles, patience, desire to serve and knowledge. This meal was a whopping $44 not including my drinks and dessert, but well worth it in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad Bar at a distance
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My salad, cheeses and Lobster Bisque
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Plantain - to cleanse your palette

bjkpnUxJ6YQXvxxbB0V1bA.text: Simply stated, my son's new favorite restaurant...and you know what? Mine too! We went on a weeknight to avoid the weekend crowds. Seated quickly by a friendly host, we were warmly welcomed and she explained how they do things. Then we began! Terrific salad bar and soups! Well presented with delicious options! My 12 year old boy loved the (Diablo styled?) shrimp and bisque, as did I. Then came the meats. Hoo boy...my son! Ever see a ravenous 12 year old growth spurting wild man in his carniverous element? There he was...and good heavens did he eat! Smiling between the samples steadily offered by serving staff constantly on the march about...he was as happy as I was with the great quality and varieties of offerings. Marvelous! Oh...and the potatoes, bread and (yummy!) bananas with cinnamon...wow! WOW! Great waitstaff. Great food. Great place! A must stop...and often!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

h53pYrc2GHd1NMajI11z7w.text: If you haven't tried a Brazilian steakhouse, you really should. They have employees in traditional garb walking around with big skewers of meat that they cut right on to your plate. They have lamb, beef, pork, and chicken. There's a bunch of different cuts and they can slice you a portion in whatever temperature you like. There's also a cold bar with various charcuterie, cheeses, sauces, oils, and vegetables (I must have eaten a full pound of nova lox with capers and goat cheese).  For dinner it is $45 for access to the meat and cold bar, and you can certainly get your money's worth.  I do however have a few criticisms. Some of the meats are smaller than you might expect (although you can certainly get more than one piece). The lamb chops and fillet mignon are on the smaller side. After my table paid we stayed for about 30 minutes and our waters were not refilled although our glasses were empty.

Dj76ieWZsd8Eq8brEWhq5Q.text: Early Xmas gift ! Night out. I love Brazilian Steakhouse's. We have. Even to many in our travels. The Texas de Brazil in Station Square is among one of the better ones on our list.  It looks from the outside a larger restaurant, but when you walk inside it really isn't, but it makes up for it in hospitality and excellent food. I enjoyed the salad bar, the Lobster Bisque, and all the delicious meat and poultry brought to the table.  Highly recommended and will visit again !!

FpOiUlB65HO4NupeX1WBug.text: Tried out the meat fest and boy did it NOT disappoint. Started our birthday celebration with 2 absolutely delicious drinks. Then proceeded to the salad bar that had endless possibilities. Our waitress brought the garlic mashed potatoes, fried cinnamon bananas, and cheesy bread. The bread was like a magic cheesy cloud!! We never even made it to the hot food bar as the meats just kept coming. We had a great table close to the kitchen which gave us prime choosing of first cuts. Our favorites were definitely the flank steak, sirloin, and Brazilian sausage.  Although the lamb chops were close behind. We would absolutely dine again. Don't forget to sign up for the club and get coupons emailed to you for a great discount!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brugal Mojito Royale (left) and Signature Caipirinha

WoTJVGaxFT5aRzdM55_yRQ.text: I just want to start by saying I do you enjoy meat. However you really have to love meat to enjoy this restaurant.  Our server was very nice and explained the menu very very well. We started off with salad and got some sides  and then the meat just started coming.   After about three stops from the meat cutters, I was pretty much done. My boyfriend kept eating because he really does love meat especially red meat. And it's not like this place is cheap, you want to get your money's worth.  I ended up getting a few more cuts of meat for myself . I love the fact that the meat is fresh and warm and cut right in front of you. I love knowing where the food is coming from. The young men cutting are super nice and definitely make the experience fun.   I finished my meal as I always do with dessert. It was cheesecake and it was huge and very good. Overall I would say yes to this place as you understand what you are getting .

mdgYXi36jIUj7DZ-r78KTg.text: When I came for a dinner time the restaurant was very busy so maybe that's why the service it was a little slow. It's better always to get a reservation in advance.  The atmosphere is very nice and clean. And there are a lot of options of food in the buffet. Meat are very delicious.  This is a place for meat lovers but if you're vegetarian there is still some options in the buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

zCblBlskNsx3xqDFf8QoTQ.text: I went here for a friend's birthday and there were 15-20 of us. We had a reservation which is a must here, they were crowded! This was my first time here and I wish I did some research because I did not go in hungry which was my main mistake but wanted to celebrate pre-bar with friends anyway. (It was a busy weekend and had multiple outings earlier in the day). This was actually my first time at a Brazilian steakhouse so I had no idea what it was like. However, I was pleasantly surprised so maybe my review is nice for a newcomer's take?  Anyway, they give you a circle card that you flip to green when you are ready to try meats and flip to red/the other side when you do not want them to come to your table anymore. There are several men that come by each table with different cuts of meat: sirloin wrapped in bacon, filet minion, lamb, pork, ribs - just every type of meat you could ask for. They do also cook medium rare - well done and the waitress did check what we prefer. We first went to the salad bar which if you are unfamiliar like I was - it is not your average salad bar - it has fish, shrimp, salads, fruit, curry style dishes, soups, bread, etc (a lot of variety). I think it is good to know to be very light with the salad bar so you have room for the meats. The meats are literally mouthwatering - the lamb stood out the most for me, very tender and juicy. I really cannot wait to go back and the next time I will be sure to come on an empty stomach to get my money's worth and enjoy more meats. I think it was just as exciting just watching them cut the meat as it was eating it.  There is a salad bar only option (which is nice for vegan and vegetarian friends) which is $24.99, the salad bar and meats is $54.99. It is pricey but if you go in hungry it is worth every penny for the quality and quantity that is available. My main tip is to not drink alcohol there - go to a bar post-dinner as their drinks are very pricey and would probably cost you nearly your meal in order to get a buzz.   The only downfall to our visit was our waitress was a little scatterbrained and actually told us she "got lost" with which tables were hers and we had to wait a bit to even get drinks refills or have her get our checks. Granted it was a busy Saturday night and I am not sure if she was maybe new but the meat servers were much more well deserving of our tips than our waitress was.  **I did take photos of the meat and videos of it being cut but it is hard to get good photos with the lighting in there. Yelp didn't let me add the videos! I guess I was more preoccupied eating it.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad bar view - beautiful flower arrangement
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad bar foods
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dim lit dining area

grykOE5qDWvlPftnSKEi2g.text: It's been a few years since my first review and I think it's time for an update. My husband and I visited with friends during restaurant week and had a great experience. Texas de Brazil was able to accommodate our party of 4 despite not having reservations. There was a 45 minute wait but we had a few drinks at the bar and our table was ready well before the quoted 45 minutes. I ordered a strawberry caipirinha and it was very sweet, but tasty nonetheless.   Compared to the competitors in the area, Texas de Brazil probably has the best salad bar. There are a lot more options here. I was also pleasantly surprised that they didn't limit the meat options during restaurant week because my experience at another churrascaria, they limited the options when the price was discounted. We had delicious lamb, filet mignon, bacon covered filet, you name it! I didn't find the meat to be over-seasoned and everything tasted great! Also loved the cheese bread and fried bananas!

q2clkFzMCJ3GkypsObj10g.text: This place is doing downhill fast. What they've been serving lately hasn't even been edible. Cold, raw meat that made someone in our group ill. They need to make changes, quickly.

nhLMLoM1RYOoku7_TThgBA.text: Been here several times. Service is hit or miss. They have a decent but not great salad bar. I have also been here when they ran out of items and didnt replace them. They need a caesar salad. The lobster bisque soup is good. I also lije the smoked salmon a lot. They will bring you a ton of meats from pork to steak to chicken to sausage to my favorite lamb chops. If the temperature is not to you choosing ask. They will try to accomodate. I never have room for dessert. Price is about $45.

H1XRnKuY_ectPZWt3bh0ZA.text: VERDICT:  A dizzying array of grilled meats and a very well stocked salad bar (available by itself, too) make this a worthy destination for carnivores and  non-carnivores alike.  SERVICE:  I've had mixed results here, ranging from good to sub-par. It seems to depend on the server, their level of knowledge, and how busy it is. On the whole, it's on the slow side, with longer than necessary waits for non-buffet items (drinks, sides, desserts). The manager did recognize me on my repeat visits though, and made it a point to come over and welcome me back, which I appreciated.  FOOD:  For those unfamiliar with the Rodizio/Churrascaria concept, diners pay a fixed price (comparable to what you'd pay for a steak entree at an upscale steakhouse) for an all-you-can-eat array of seasoned grilled meats. The meats are brought out from the kitchen on skewers and portions are carved off directly at your table and onto your plate. You can indicate whether you want the servers to come around again by flipping an indicator at your table from red to green.  TdB is worth the price of admission for the lamb alone. Lamb still isn't on the menu at too many restaurants, and over here, it's prepared beautifully, both as chops and as leg of lamb. Try it with the mint jelly from the salad bar and you won't be disappointed. If lamb isn't your thing, fear not - you could always get the chicken parm, flank steak, sausage, ribs, sirloin, or a variety of meats wrapped in bacon, including a bacon wrapped filet. And then there are those delicious warm biscuits.  If it all seems a little overwhelming, I'd skip the ribs and the filet mignon. There are  restaurants and steakhouses a plenty that serve these items, and frankly, do a better job of it. The parmesan crusted chicken isn't particularly noteworthy either. To get the biggest gastronomical bang for my buck, I'd concentrate on the lamb, the flank steak (goes great with the potatoes), the sausage, and the Picanha, which is the house specialty. Picanha is a steak cut popular in Brazil, similar to Top Sirloin, which is how it is sometimes referred to here. At TdB, they have it available seasoned with garlic and without. Despite my love of garlic, I preferred the non-garlic version for its subtler flavors.  Every dinner also includes the salad bar, which puts anything at other chain establishments to shame. In addition to salad of course, there are soups, sushi, cured meats, cheeses, and fruit. In fact, it's tempting to fill up on the salad bar alone. Fortunately for those of us who want to do just that, or are vegetarian/pescatarian, the salad bar is also available by itself for a lower price.   AMBIANCE: TdB's location in Station Square gives it a festive vibe, especially on the two or three days a year when Pittsburgh has nice weather. The decor of the restaurant itself is a bit garish and the lighting could stand to be a not quite so bright, but aside from that, still reasonably upscale - think birthday dinner, not anniversary.  BOTTOM LINE:  What's not to like about unlimited beef, chicken, pork and lamb? Until and unless a Fogo de Chao opens in Pittsburgh, this remains a better bet than the past-its-prime Green Forest churrascaria in Penn Hills.

b30OVT2j1m3l3pIA9HO8BQ.text: We went here on Saturday for lunch.  While they were busy they were by no means crazy busy.  I have been to a couple Brazilian steakhouses but not this brand.  The food was great.....when it came around.  There were many times we had clean plates waiting for someone to come around with more meat.  While the salad bar was always stocked I did not come here to spend $29.99 to eat salad. Our server was OK, nothing spectacular and by no means a ball of fire.  The last Brazilian steakhouse I ate at, the waiter was always bringing clean plates and taking away dirty ones.  We had to go to the salad bar for clean plates several times and the dirty ones sat on our table for quite a while before they were taken away.  Our waiter never once brought clean plates or  brought out more bread.   All in all for the price we paid, it was an ok experience, however next time I am going to spend that kind of money, I will go to the Cheesecake Factory.

jk-sFdX2r6flIpl6Z4II1w.text: If you like Brazillian BBQ or a fan of meat, then this is a great place.  Brazillian BBQ, all kinds of meat (beef, pork, chicken, lamb) circulating around the tables with waiters offering all you can eat, freshly cooked or grilled.  Offerings are of different cooking degrees (well, medium, rare).  Delicious salad bar and side dishes offered.  Not cheap, but the dishes are all delicious and all you can eat.  Definitely a treat if you are a fan of good meat dishes.  The side dishes are so good you need to be careful to save room for the meat!

p5Hvn4njPAlj5gl7xr7tSw.text: First time at a Brazilian steak house. Very nice atmosphere. Service was excellent. Salad bar was impressive with a nice variety of foods. An experience every meat lover should have!

upAFFXvvLxZXgBpv-JCWDw.text: I have eatin all over the world and I would rate this dinner experience in the top 3!  Service was great, food was delicious and price was right!!!! Highly recommend it!

h7SGfI3w4i1yyojhrEKoYQ.text: I have been here twice now. First as part of a pay off four and secondly as a party of 8. Both times the food was good but service was lacking. I felt like the waitress assumed we would be satisfied with the food conning by so drinks and side dishes went unfilled.  It gets 3 Stars for food alone.

_qA38QfJB97WtVNIQkE_eQ.text: My favorite place to eat by far. Why pay 50$ for one steak when i can have a plethora of meats. 5 stars must try.

kv4tgmqXa3N28Ww3GDA-vg.text: Great for a special occasion. Pricey but entertaining. The service was top notch. At least 4 managers continuously came over making sure any and all needs were met. The experience is fun of having a plethora of meats come by your table. If I went back I would just need the salad bar which was full of shrimp, cheese, smoked salmon, sushi, lobster bisque etc.. ( and half the price) Quickly full before the meat even started! Boyfriend loved the endless steaks coming by. Beware of the meat sweats.

G-WBSoUhektw9c6FOy5cXQ.text: Great customer service when you step in the door! I have a peanut allergy and the waiters made sure to check everything before serving it to me. Even if they thought it had been processed in the area, they advised me not to try it. My experience here was AWESOME! I'll be back.

YW42vxG3R2KaRRBjZF6a6g.text: Went there with my dad and friends of ours for a night out. Food was good like normal, but still not like others I have had. Everything is fine until some guy that looked like Lex Luthor's second cousin "the manager" said we couldn't use a $25 voucher that we received FROM THEM for my birthday, because we already used one at the table. I think it's funny, because WE DIDN'T USE ONE YET. He didn't feel like putting it in and didn't care at all. Then, he proceeded to follow us to the front of the restaurant like a creep. Before you go, take this review in consideration. Thank You

DzNz1Ms9J42BdTjPeqO-CA.text: We used to love coming here, and did so a few times per year.  The second to last time we came, the meats came out at a very slow pace, and the service was not that great.  We gave them a second chance, thinking the previous time was an off night.  The following time it was worse.  We were seated by the entrance door, and most of the meats that came out of the kitchen, were snatched up by other diners, before they made it to our table.  The only thing arriving at our table were the less popular meats, and these took 10-15 minutes between meats, to arrive.  (we timed them).  We mentioned this to our waiter, which to his credit, I believe passed the message on, but to no avail.  The manager finally came over and assured us more meats would be coming soon, but we had lost our appetites by then.  Another note:  The Brazilian sausage that we love, was replaced by, (I kid you not), what looked and tasted like Hillshire Farm, grocery store sausage.  I'm not sure if they didn't get their regular shipment of sausage meat, and had to resort to this, but it was sad and insulting that they tried to pass this off as a normal offering.  We still have a $50 gift card for this restaurant, but will most likely try to sell this to someone else to use.  We can't risk getting burned a third time.

tYxnmY6rqEguq71CDQR9PA.text: We went to this restaurant for a 7:00 dinner during Restaurant Week. This was the first time I'd ever been to a Brazilian churrascaria, and maybe I'm just easily impressed, but I LOVED this place.  We probably had to wait 5-10 minutes to be seated even though we had a reservation. It seemed like the restaurant is understaffed, as there was only one host and a manager was running around trying to help her out. It then took a good few minutes for one of the servers to take our drink order, but after that everything picked up in speed.  The website indicates the dress code is business or smart casual, but I saw a few dudes there in Harley tees, so it seems like basically anything goes. My husband and I were dressed in nice jeans and a blazer and a more casual dress, respectively, and didn't feel out of place.  I was kind of preparing to be disappointed with the meal, to be honest. Reading the selection of meats that are unlimited in your experience, I thought it was going to be a too good to be True situation.  It wasn't. Everything was delicious.   They serve all red meat medium rare, and being someone who usually orders meat cooked medium well, I was a little hesitant. I shouldn't have been. If you like your meat well done, tell the server and they will cut it from the outside, where it is cooked more thoroughly. I didn't bother requesting this though because I found that most of the meat was only a bit pinker that I am normally used to, but I enjoyed it just the same. The fillets were all cooked medium to medium well and are juicy but not bloody.   Yes, the meat is salty. I am a bit of a salt-a-holic, so it was just about perfect for me. That being said, by the end of the meal my lips did feel a little weird from eating all the salt!  My husband's favorite was the bacon wrapped fillet, I loved the house special, and our servers stopped by multiple times to ask if we wanted those cuts sent back over. As the staff mentions, any one of them is at your service. If you see any server, you can ask them for more plates, specific meats, drinks, water, dessert, even your check. They all work together and it seems to be a good system given the nature of the restaurant.  The salad bar looked delicious but I didn't take very much from it on this trip. I'm a red meat fan and was gearing up to a eat a lot of it, so I skipped things I would have otherwise enjoyed. Before coming to the restaurant, I couldn't imagine paying $25.00 just for the salad bar, but after seeing what it contains: sushi, salmon, greens, soup, rice, potatoes and your more standard salad items, I might just consider it.  We took our deserts to go--I was happy that the let us, some restaurants can be a bit strict during restaurant week promotions--key lime pie was awesome.  The meal was delicious, but if you eat the way we did, I can't imagine frequenting this place very often.

87Yfpku_mjf0dUCDi0N0Kw.text: We had a terrific meal! There was a constant flow of meat! Top sirloin was our favorite! The ladies would have liked just getting the salad bar - there were plenty of filling treats there! Salmon and shrimp, cheese, rice and soup - plus lots of veggies! My only criticism is that the food was a little salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brazilian Cheesecake!

r-xhi8nXwcHNUeSrsd_bng.text: We were wandering Station Square and thankfully my boyfriend got excited over Brazilian steak. We were seated immediately at a quiet table in the corner overlooking the restaurant so we had a great view of everyone and could see where all the meats were at! Our waiter Raymond was on point!! He totally made out visit! The meats were cooked to a medium rare perfection. The lamb was out of this world with their mint jelly. Raymond made us a topping of rice, beans and Brazilian vingerette which again was quite tasty! The salad bar options ranged from traditional Brazilian to Japanese to American. Totally something eh for everyone. We passed on the desserts because none of them were too appealing after such an amazing dinner.

Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lemons for our water

weXifj6tDCO-rldptHuLVg.text: Excellent!  You will get a small card. Green means the servers will continue to bring meat to your table. Red means they will bypass your table until you turn your card again.  They will bring around huge skewers of perfectly cooked meat. The waiter will also bring fried banana as a palate cleanser and garlic mashed potatoes probably to fill your stomach. They also have a huge "salad bar" with sushi, cheeses, vegetables, and soups.  They have a large selections of wine available by glass or bottle.  The price is pretty steep but you will get your money's worth. We paid about 50$ per plate.  This would be a great place for a special event.  Will definitely come here again!

0jT5b_cOkXYus7qiY6bybQ.text: Lots of food. Lots and lots and lots of food. This isn't your average buffet dinner, this is where you go to get stuffed. I had been to a Brazillian bbq out in orlando a few years back so I knew these things existed and the charm of the place.  With their restaurant week deal, I could not pass up on the opportunity (it was 35 plus tax and tip for unlimited salad bar/meats and a choice of dessert) - still expensive but definitely better than the regular price.  The salad bar was good, I would have expected a little more variety but oh well. The meats were delicious. I loved the leg of lamb and the lamb chops. The brazilian sausage was another good piece of meat as well. The pecan pie hit the spot at the end.  I am not lying when I say I did not eat anything until dinner the next day. I stuffed myself. It was a great experience (but being frugal and a grad student, I don't think I could go here often) - nonetheless, I will be back to devour some glorious food.  (We visited the bar but it seemed a bit overpriced for our taste so we didn't really get anything)  The servers and the people walking around with the skewers were very cordial as well and answered any questions quickly.

c9ENHRktrkz2EI1SuKZSFQ.text: I first was introduced to this restaurant when living in Fort Worth Texas for a year. I loved this place! It's a Brazilian churrascaria  which really means it's a Brazilian cowboy barbecue. Sounds simple enough but it's better!!!  This is an all you can eat monster meat bonanza like nothing you have experienced before unless you've eaten here. It's an all you can eat buffet but here's the twist... servers walk around with sword like skewers full of the best cuts of meat cooked to perfection. You have a little disk you flip over from red for no I'm good to green which is load me up with meat. This is the highlight of this wonderful place to eat. That isn't to take away from the salad bar which has many great items itself such as the prosciutto or the awesome cheeses. Did I also mention that yes they also have a full service bar that is spot on!

JYNJr-67aAefbORr8HH2tw.text: Honestly wanted to give this place a 4-star rating, but in the end decided against it. As like many of restaurants of its type, there are two options: either full bar or salad bar only. Though most people who come here would probably find this place pretty dope in terms of a relatively plentiful selection of meats, salad bar offerings, service, and whatnot, I was a bit dismayed to find that the salad bar was a bit lacking in terms of fresh fruits/veggies options goes. So many carbs, so many oily options ... didn't really help my conscience that I was eating a bunch of meat as well (though I don't exactly come here for that very reason). Otherwise, great place to come to in terms that steakhouses go. Be warned that parking can be a bit annoying since it's in Station Square, which tends to be a bit more expensive parking-wise if you don't have validated parking (for those who work there) or leased parking.

BAoXLN2GDEtGmrYa36D9Mg.text: After giving up on the staff at Joe's Crab Shack for my father's birthday dinner (for some reason he likes it there, why, I don't know), my family settled on trying Texas de Brazil based on some initial feedback we had received from a friend and the sheer smell of meat radiating across the plaza.  The wife and I had an OK previous experience at Green Forest, but unfortunately, Texas de Brazil left us rather dissatisfied with the entire evening.  Following a rather disorganized seating process (the hostess more or less insisted we head to the bar to wait, but no sooner did we get there and attempt to order drinks, two separate servers tried to come seat us), we were sat at a table.  We waited an easy 5-10 minutes before anyone even came to the table.  Once our server arrived, he more or less just said to go grab our food (we still hadn't received water at this point), at which time, we interjected that two of our guests would be getting the lite dinner option (which he immediately became disgruntled and attempted to insist that they get the full dinner - go figure, the meals were $20 cheaper).  Throughout the evening, we only received one refill on water even though our glasses were consistently empty.  Also, while it seemed there were a wide variety of meats to be enjoyed, the same 3-4 options kept being brought to the table (on our way out, I noticed 3 different meats that never even made it to our table to try).  In addition, the cheese bread, potatoes, and bananas all went un-replenished once the first set was eaten.  After a certain point, we simply decided we wanted to cut our losses and leave the restaurant (but we couldn't, as the server couldn't be found to ask for the check - we had to ask a gaucho to find him for us).  The final straw in our experience was the fact that we were charged 18% gratuity for what has been the worse service we've received year to date in Pittsburgh.  This is why I don't let family pick restaurants for celebratory dinners.  For the $43 + tax/gratuity per person that we had to drop on this bucket, I could of easily taken them to any of the best-in-class joints the burgh has to offer.  What a waste.

v7QH9iDrb816rEVhss5f-g.text: Great service, amazing food, and our waitress was fantastic! With the exception of the lamb being a little tough a gamey, all the other meats were cooked perfectly and tasted amazing. For dessert we had the carrot cake which was moist throughout all three layers, and also the chocolate cake. That's more my wife's thing but she assures me it was quite delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carrot cake perfection

wiXUp1_pK0i6baRY1IgBlg.text: The food was much better than I expected. Since it is a chain, expectations are lower. We were seated just before the dinner rush. So we had an easy time getting around the salad bar. The salad bar was almost exciting. We actually loved the salad with the homemade dressings. The bisque was extremely good.  We decided to get meat right away. My teenage sons just couldn't wait. There was a constant flow of meats. We agreed that the flank steak was the best. Our second choice was a toss up because there were so many good choices. I could see how it could get too busy and perhaps the server could forget to bring something requested. But the meat never stops.  We had fun and were pleasantly surprised. We were celebrating two birthdays, so we got two free desserts. Yes, it is expensive so I couldn't go often. But I will certainly go back.

K-3oa52yYc2C5T4kjy5zGw.text: Are you a meat and potatoes kind of person?  Forget the potatoes and be ready to eat meat-LOTS of meat. They do have a "salad bar" but it's not your typical salad bar. It's a little high end with charcuterie options, quinoa salads, and lots of other options. They also have soup. The Lobster Bisque is rather thin but full of flavor. You serve yourself from the salad bar and soup which both come with your meal. When you are ready to eat meat you sit at your table and the meat parade (as I call it) begins. They bring huge skewers of different meats to your table. We tried everything. The filet was melt in your mouth but we found ourselves liking the lamb the most. Of course they had pork tenderloin and other types of meat. They were all delicious. All of the servers were friendly and made the experience enjoyable.  It is a bit pricy but worth every penny.

ULpFMe8pQYsfnnHkIED-8w.text: Service ... Perfect, Food... Perfect, Ambiance... Perfect.   I was completely blown away by Texas de Brazil! The service from the moment we sat down was impeccable. The caipirinhas were ok, but not as good as Seviche- for my taste palate. However, the food is what took this restaurant to a perfect score in my opinion.  The salad/cold bar is packed with the good stuff; mushrooms, potato salad, regular salad, salmon (which is amazing), asparagus, tabouleh, and the list goes on.   The best part of the meal was all the meat. I'm not a huge meat eater in everyday life, but if you come here - be prepared for a protein overload (in a good way). The chicken selections were okay, but my favorites were the lamb chops, steak selections, and BBQ pork ribs. Yes... I had them ALL! They also have leg of lamb, parmesan chicken, bacon wrapped chicken, filet mignon, bacon wrapped chicken, flank steak, beef ribs, sausage, parmesan pork, etc,. Plus- they bring mashed potatoes, bread, and fried bananas to the table.   I would recommend saving your appetite for Texas de Brazil in order to try everything your heart desires.   I will be back soon, and suggest this restaurant to everyone I know!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. From the cold/salad bar
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My plate of meat before the madness began

yqGuXyZhzSOxYnO8p9wusg.text: The food was delicious, a little on the pricey side. I wouldn't recommend taking children under the age of 12. Very nice atmosphere and the customer service was exceptional.

ZXh6x_eeQTfSoyvy4OAkdA.text: This restaurant is a meat lover's dream!!  The aroma of delicious steak is alluring the minute you walk through the door and it's quite intoxicating.     Ambiance is a little upscale and so inviting.    The salad bar is quite majestic and so many options to choose from scalloped potatoes, real/crispy bacon slices, soup, asparagus, variety of cheese, shrimp, etc.  Just ordering the salad bar as your meal would suffice.  My date and I turned over our disks on our table to the "green" side (to indicate that we are ready to be served) the once the skewers of the delicious grilled carved meat starting coming .. the experience began!    Filet Mignon wrapped in bacon, Brazilian Sausage, Parmesan crusted pork loin etc.    Our waitress did state to "pace yourself" but that was difficult to do because once you started to taste one selection - another one would arrive.   I had a tough time turning my little disk on our table to the "red" side -which halted any new meat from arriving.  We received two sides - garlic mashed potatoes and sweet grilled bananas (which are supposed to cleanse your pallet).  The mashed potatoes were tasty but the garlic was a bit too strong for my taste. The grilled bananas were different.        The restaurant was busy and seemed as if our waitress was overwhelmed it took a little while for our drinks to arrive.  Our water goblets were not refilled either.   This was a great experience and I look forward to my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Digging the decor in the lobby of the restrooms.. the color red is so striking.(sorry picture is blurry)
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicous carved meat ...  steak/pork ..   ahh heaven
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Restrooms...clean.. high ceilings .. love the dark red decor

P3ps-Y552C5jhQjcQdps4A.text: This place is great. My family is from Brazil and we really enjoy visiting this place. It is fun to take others as well. This place is good for larger groups, call ahead, they can accommodate but they're always packed, even on weekdays. The wait is never long. We love coming. We always get caipirinhas to drink! It's a Brazilian staple drink. The "salad bar" is insane, it isn't your typical American salad bar. It has over 60 items and has much more food variety in it! The featured soup was lobster bisque when we went. Delicious!! If you love meat, this is the place for you. You pay $45 a person and it's all you can eat "salad bar", and meats. They have different types of steak, lamb, sausages, chicken and much more!! We will be back again and again! We have been here many times. Try the picahna, it's the best meat they offer!! My family always makes it. High quality place, good place for special occasions.
