Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

voIHhvka9dn9yCTbIQeDJw.text: My daughter, her son and I tried out Texas de Brazil.  As expected, the meat kept coming and was tasty. The servers were very accommodating to bring us meat that was more or less done if we wanted something different than what was brought over. In general the service was very good.  My daughter tried some of their cocktails. The tastes were very interesting, but I found them a bit expensive ($10 each for a small tumbler filled mostly with ice).  The salad bar was not exceptional one way or another. They did not run out of anything and the food looked fresh.  We were so stuffed that we did not try any deserts, but they looked yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Server bringing some more meat

8-1PNA3gWoWC2Wlt_etlRg.text: Texas de Brazil has become one of my family and friends favorite places to go for dinner. This past weekend I made reservations for a party of 15 with the help of the Manager ( I believe his name was Mike ). When we arrived the table was ready and waiting for us at 7:45. The salad bar was stocked full with great choices of fresh foods. The meats were all amazing, I like my food cooked a little longer and they are very accommodating to that fact. Our server was Ryan and he was very informative and fun for our entire group.   My only complaint was the bathroom situation. I'm positive they did not do a bathroom check for the two hours we spent there. There was toilet paper and fecal matter all over every stall but one. It's a Saturday night, I understand they are busy but this needs addressed. I'm disappointed in the ladies that left it in such disarray.

Lk9N_YMtiJ-FVNaRm7IRsw.text: Quite a bit of fun. Lots of food and festive. Texas de Brasil offers the typical American take on a Brazilian Steak House. The unique serving style can only be found at a couple of local places in the Pittsburgh region.  All of the Brasil steakhouse restaurants in Pgh are similar. They are all delicious. Texas de Brasil is superior in the sense that Station Square is by far a much nicer setting for a night out in comparison to the local competing Brazilian style steak houses. Texas de Brasil is a national chain and one can expect the consistency found in most national chains.  Consistency is good.   I highly recommend avoiding this location during any promotional events. We made the mistake of making a reservation without realizing it was restaurant week. The place was packed beyond packed and the restaurant experience was not worth the small discount offered.  The staff appeared a bit stretched thin and wait times on meat carvings was much longer than usual.  Wait staff was a tab bit less attentive than usual. For example we had to ask for the meat servers to return at least five times before they did so. (That is unheard of during other nights we have dined) Also, the mint jelly did not taste the way it typically does and the waitstaff seemed too spread thin to be concerned about the fermented quality. (Sadly their mint jelly is what makes their lamb exceptional)   Go on a regular evening so you can leisurely dine without the insanity of over bookings. Yes, the experience is not low cost however it's a fun evening out. Expect on a regular evening to be FLOCKED with various meat carvings. Food and drinks arrive quickly and the staff will be charming.  You will leave satisfied and slightly shocked at the amount of meat you can consume! Texas de Brasil is a great location for a family night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

spfuSGJ8mcGLu6aQzLcung.text: This is my first time at a Texas de Brazil, and it was an excellent experience. I was surprised that I could sit at the bar and be served meat, so I took that opportunity. The bartender and servers were polite and attentive. The salad bar was fresh, the bread was hot, and I got au gratin potatoes... a dish that I've missed for the past year or so at Fogo de Chao, another Brazilian steakhouse. I recommend this place based on my first experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ckhHcDPwp9GlYreYXsgrQg.text: I really wanted to love this place but our experience last night left a lot to be desired. Let's start with service.. we had a reservation and were promptly seated. And then we waited and waited for probably 15 minutes before a guest I was with flagged down a meat server to send a waiter over... then as the night went on our waiter finally brought over clean plates after our plates were filled with meat scrapes for awhile. We were there for about an hour when he asked "are you done?" And grabbed all of our plates and the clean ones off the table. Some people at our table were not done yet so I felt like we were really rushed out of this place even though there were maybe 10 tables there. Next, the food.. I enjoyed some items at the salad bar and thought they had a good/unique selection. The meat was okay.. I thought some of it was way TOO rare and I usually enjoy rare meat. I know they cook their meat on rock salt but some pieces were so extremely salty and inedible. All the meat servers rushed our table when we first sat down and then they were no where to be found about 45 minutes in which I thought was really strange. Dessert was okay but I feel as if 9 dollars for a piece of cake is pretty outrageous. All in all this place was just okay. Service was seriously lacking and food was just ok. For the price I feel as if all aspects of the dining experience should be outstanding but in this case it just wasn't.

CuORSwNPJyWEEc72BImVyQ.text: The reason why I gave one star is because the hostesses were very rude. My husband tried to make a reservation this afternoon, we both called them several times and they never picked up the phone. So we left the message for them and told them we would have four people and asked them to call us back about the status of our reservation. They didn't called us back. 4 hours later When we got to the restaurant, the hostesses very rudely and abruptly told us the wait was an hour and a half without even saying hello, despite the fact that the restaurant was half empty. My husband explained that he had called several times but nobody had picked up the phone to which they replied that they were too busy to pick up their own phone. Their attitude was very unprofessional and we will not be returning ever. It is a shame because the first time we went here we really liked it and we were hoping to introduce his parents to it. But it was embarrassing to be treated that way after talking the restaurant up so much. They have lost our business permanently.

JDbYyMqXKBOhkRaBCWz3Kg.text: Went for my cousins birthday and it was a great experience all of the food was fresh and overall tasty. I will say the drinks were a bit pricy but the food was worth the price because it's pretty much all you can eat. Great staff as well

ZBtUiP-rKXzTwu2kDn6cvg.text: We  had our company Christmas party there on Friday night and was very disappointed.   Our waitress was terrible.  She forgot our drinks twice and I went up to the manager for him to get them for us.  She was only waiting on 3 tables besides our table and the restaurant was not that busy.  She did not refill our waters. Two of our people had a little bit of their dessert left and she asked if they needed a box and they said yes but she never brought them back after ten minutes so they left them on the table. For the amount of money we spent on this dinner I expected the service to be excellent.  On a positive note the food was delicious.  Last time it was really salty and this time it was much better.  Probably the last time we will be there.

hgWUj0xgOyBPjkZKKJWDEw.text: Great service, decor and food. I was very pleased with my overall experience at this new Pittsburgh Churrascaria. I've been to quite a few Brazilian steakhouses and the quality of meat here is one of the highest I've had. The flank steak was my favorite, with a gamier, more grassy flavor to the meat. Very different and awesome. The quality of the filet mignon was excellent, too, and I consider myself a filet connosieur. :) Try the traditional Brazilian drink Caipirinha. It is a sweeter, smoother version of a margarita but made with rum. They have a few flavors, strawberry being my favorite. Our server Eddie was incredibly personable, funny, and efficient. He took care of all of my food allergies and let me know what was safe!   Gluten free info: most of the meats are gluten free, but a lot of the salad bar/hot food bar items aren't. In fact, I was told every hot food bar item had gluten in it, as well as the bread, salami, shrimp and salmon on the salad bar. No Fogo de Chao similarities there.  Soy allergy: do not eat any meat that has been marinated, no salad dressings, no marinated items on the salad bar. All have soybean oil. However, the chef specially made cuts of meat for me without marinade so I could sample everything! Very hospitable.   There was a little miscommunication about what was safe for me to eat, but considering this is a new restaurant and I have a billion food allergies, they worked very hard to make sure I didn't get sick!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry Caipirinha. 5 bucks during happy hour! Tastes like a margarita with rum instead of tequila.

gxJy3pkDFPv4AN9ZviMMFg.text: Delicious salad bar with super fresh greens, cheeses, prosciutto, prepared veggies and fruits. The fresh grilled meats were served endlessly, each one better than the the next!! The staff were very helpful and courteous. You definitely will not be hungry when you leave here!!

uzj6Oki4VoP3bdU8PT0RIA.text: It was my first time at this location and it was nice to be on the water and the surrounding area was beautiful. The vibe in the restaurant was okay, it wasn't very busy and our wait time was much shorter than anticipated.  It seemed like the employees were not very happy to be there but that could be because we were there during restaurant week. I will be returning for sure, and I will update accordingly!

qEq_l1nBdHr_uJABzV6CiQ.text: Pretty good Brazilian themed chain restaurant located in Station Square. Definitely an upscale vibe as far as the decor. Our server was super polite and very nice.  If you've never been to a Brazilian churrascaria place, it's basically a meat buffet. You get a card that you can turn to red or green. Red means stop and green means keep it coming. Steak, chicken parmasean, bacon wrapped steak, skirt steak, filet, lamb and a few more. Servers walk around with skewers and they cut off pieces of you want to try it.  There's also a salad bar with some hot sides and soup. The lobster bisque was good. I try not to fill up on the sides so I can have room for the meat. There weren't much side hot side options. The Jasmine rice was good. Some of the meat was a little salty but otherwise ok.  The price was a little high for the small side and salad bar.

RrmDbMUO0JoByoSSOOaLAw.text: I knew this would be an expensive meal before going. Overall 3 1/2 stars. We had 2 adults, 2 kids (6&8) and bill was $200 after tip. We had food plus pitcher of sangria and ginger ale for kids because that was the only drink served that was refillable. Also split 1 slice of chocolate mousse cake. With adjustments for drinks and kids meals(see below) this could easily be 4.5 stars and overall value worth the visit.   Food: 4 1/2 stars because the meats are amazing, salad bar alone is a mEal and quite impressive. The meat comes with two cinnamon sugar plantains and mashed potatoes. There is jasmine rice, wine portobello shrooms etc on buffet to compliment the meat course. Kids enjoy the salad bar so if we went again I wouldn't waste the meat on them. Stick to salad bar for kids as there's bacon, shrimp, salmon, cold cuts, vegetables, rice, fruit for them. You can save money this way. Older kids however would enjoy the meat. Only downside is beef served med-rare. We specially requested med-well and I felt the beef/ lamb cuts were not as good quality. They had more fat on them. Also the lobster bisque had zero lobster in it. It was like a sherry lobster favored broth which was disappointing.  Drinks: 1 star. Way too expensive. I enjoy wine but the markups here are 3x or more for a bottle. Rex Goliath is 10-12$ and it was priced at $39. In stead we got a pitcher of sangria which had no alcohol whatsoever. For $29 it was like an expensive fruit filled pitcher of juice. Kids drinks aren't refillable except ginger ale. Stick to water while you're here. About 20% of the bill can be saved by sticking to water and drinks here are a rip-off.   Ambiance: 4.5 stars. Restaurant is well decorated, CLEAN (bathrooms and buffet were in top condition). Took away half star because the tables are a bit close for my taste and we had a stroller for a sleeping baby.   Service: 4 1/2 stars. Our waitress was great. She always had a clean plate for us and was very attentive. I took half star away because even when our cards were red the meat servers still kept coming by. They almost swarm your table which can be overwhelming a little bit trying to get your own meat and manage kids who need theirs cut up. That said you definitely get a full plate of great tasting meat. They also don't rush you out. Managers as well were on the floor the entire time making sure everything was running smoothly and asked everyone how the were enjoying their meals. Dirty Plates are quickly gathered and new ones magically appearing as well. This restaurant gets the importance of good service.

vdo3cC00v4pg6idBjMEDiQ.text: Whoa! I've never had to just quit! Meat Meat and more good Meat ! Fantastic service fantastic meats fire cooked and seasoned to perfection!! Do it if ya haven't yet!! Do it till ya gotta tap out, you won't be disappointed

91PjarDnEkl6ZpDCCwpYaw.text: Definitely a unique experience. You flip your token to green and the servers will bring you more kinds of meats than you can imagine, all freshly cooked and carved right onto your plate. Ribs, bacon wrapped filet mignon, sirloin, everything. Flip the token to red to stop. There's a huge bar of sides, and you should definitely help yourself generously so you're not gorging yourself on meat alone. There was a lobster bisque that I absolutely loved. The only reason why I didn't give them 5 stars is because the meat is super salty.

4aTS81h-0NkifdwoNaqkCg.text: Discovered this place on mine and my husbands anniversary, we intended to eat at The Melting Pot but didn't realize we needed to make reservations. So we stuck around Station Square and decided on this place. Wow! We were blown away! This is now our go-to special occasion restaurant. Everything from the deep fried bananas that are used as a palette cleanser, to the immense options at the salad bar, to the endless meats brought to your table at your desire are amazing. This superb dining experience is worth every penny. The staff is very professional. I recommend coming here hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Complimentary dessert for our Anniversary!

WnIYw5Jb5KgIlzc9Xnq--w.text: I had a really nice experience here! We had a reservation, but we got there a little early and were seated immediately. Our server was friendly and attentive. The salad bar had a ton of interesting options to choose from and most of the meats that I tried were absolutely delicious! The only ones I didn't particularly care for were the chicken and the pork loin. I don't like lamb myself so I didn't try any of it, but my boyfriend did and he said all of the lamb options were fantastic. My favorite meat was the Brazilian sausage. Dinner was a little expensive at $45 a person, but for the variety and amount of food you can get it makes sense. Definitely would recommend this place!

7ZADE5-NYHOFC8PyaYl0Bw.text: If you are craving for meat and wine come to Texas de Brasil! Really nice place!  Delicious food, wide selection of vine!  Come hungry! And grab a buddy!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

No3HSLqJ_TaxtxmxEVxKYw.text: Delicious.  I like food well done and they were accommodating to that. The Parmesan chicken was delicious. And at the end we got some BBQ brisket.  Yum!

hF5b4BIR5SX4AGMgxwlYVg.text: I can finally say I try this place. I heard many good things about this place. I will say this place is a solid four stars for me. I know this place is all about their Brazilian meat, but I am actually a bigger fan of their salad bar. I would come here just for salad bar. I tried one of their cheese I forget the name, it was so delicious! Also they have sushi maki rolls which are pretty good too. The range of the selection is just so wide. They got soup, chilli, cold cuts, cheese, sushi salmon, rice, couscous, shrimps...etc. everything from the salad bar was so tasty. I realized the red meat upset my stomach so I actually didn't have many, those I tried were good though. Also, I got their banana foster as dessert, it was excellent! What a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meattttt
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana foster with ice cream
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheesy bread and mash potatoes

g2mlLSTIS8Mr56z35nloBA.text: Team dinner - they had great meat rotation and quick service. However, some meats took a bit too long, dessert took forever and their $5 cappuccino didn't include a biscuit.

Tt5iqpRhi_BnYClHp7Oubw.text: This place is literally fantastic!! Huge 50 item salad with everything on it from salad, to lobster bisque, to sushi! The meats are seriously to die for, and they are never ending! It was a bit over crowded and most of the guests were dressed super casual (which I thought was kinda inappropriate) but I will certainly be back!!!

AQFbZgyRCpVK_tVKj8rMGg.text: We dined at Texas de Brazil during restaurant week, which was awesome because the meal was $10 off and it came with a dessert.  The restaurant was busy, but our waitress, Autumn, was completely on the ball. Our water glasses never went empty and she was conscious of what needed refilled on the table and asked several times if there was any particular types of meat we were looking for.  We ordered a pitcher of the house sangria, which was plenty enough for the three of us drinking it. My husband had the speciality mojito, which was also delicious.   The cold bar had an excellent variety of meats, cheeses, salads, sushi, and shrimp. We could not get enough of the cheese bread balls and the plantains! We could do without the mashed potatoes.  The meats were delivered regularly and everyone who came to our table was very friendly. They even accommodated numerous requests for our meat to be cooked to a higher temperature (the meat is typically cooked to medium rare). The quality is f meat was top notch (says my father the butcher). The beef rib fell off the bone and was a huge hit at our table. My husband also ate the lamb, which he said was delicious. They had a house special top sirloin and the seasoning was amazing!  Yes, the meat is very salty, but they explain up front that it's because of how's it's prepared (traditionally on a bed of rock salt).   This restaurant is everything we expected it to be: a meat lover's paradise.

EK_Ss02R256rmimp0kw4yQ.text: Went here on Saturday night with some friends.  At first I was a little confused with the set up.  I did not understand how it worked.   The buffet was good.  Good cheese, good meats, good salad.  When the meats started coming out it was like heaven.  The people who brought things out were very nice.  The meats were very good and our waitress was amazing.  We told her we wanted more poppers and more lamb and she had it brought it up.  I will be back.  As a tip if you want more of something.   Tell your waitress.

ZMhDZj1fQwdKjJ00-FonZQ.text: Went with my aunt and cousin while they were in town and I was blown away.  Fantastic food and excellent service.  Literally every bite of food I put in my mouth was delicious.  It is pricy but great for a super special dinner out.

GTdVurYWi2Oe3vw27XgfqA.text: Dinner with wife,son and daughter. Food unparalleled, fantastic taste. Wait staff exceptionally good. Unacceptable noise level, feels as though your in a cafeteria. Wine prices far too high. Will definitely go back again but with ear plugs.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6lgRinMl9nKARP8-_2DsTQ.text: I have the restaurant 3 stars because it was amazing service, the buffet was clean and well organized and our waitress was very helpful the buffet had fresh cheeses, sliced meats, vegetables and your average salad bar. They also had a hot section with three choices, rice beans and cheesy potatoes. I would say if your a meat lover this place is for you, the samples are small but you can ask for more. The meat to me and my family seemed a bit salty. We went through so many waters at dinner because of how salty the meat was. There was a lot of options but I don't think it's worth the price. It was a fun experience but honestly just a glorified buffet. I've had better steaks and meat elsewhere.

e52fKJa9ITJN0pJzbdTLJw.text: Freaking awesome. Great sides, loved the bar. The shrimp was very undervalued. As far as the meats, I would have to go with the top sirloin, great taste!!! Also the bacon wrapped chicken was pretty tasty as well.  It was a little odd that they didn't have fountain coke. But what do I know I don't own a multi million dollar restaurant. Can't wait till our one opens in Lexington!!!

eLW62qmorBW5ZbOqB1jSBw.text: As time has gone on, the service at this Texas de Brazil has only gone downhill.  We've been here at least 3 times over the past year.  Food at the salad bar was not replenished...I ordered a refill of my drink and had to remind the waitress after a half hour that I still hadn't gotten it...it was a soft drink and for the first time ever I was charged for a refill of ginger ale.  The meat either came all at once or we went long stretches where the servers didn't come around at all.  The variety of meats has seemingly been reduced over the past year or so, too.  I'm aware that a new Brazilian meat buffet has opened in downtown and my wife and I both decided we would try somewhere else the next time we go out for this type of experience.  For two adults and two kids it cost over $140.  For that price I expect more.

rf5o2YEDXxm03tqFDQQdUA.text: Went for a prebirthday treat with great friends from work. I'm insanely full!! The meats were medium rare, and just kept coming and coming, the food was perfect. The salad bar and sides were top notch in quality. Service was impeccable.

oi1YzTTI3-ZwkQfF30jUpQ.text: I finally ventured in here for lunch today - I heard good things and wasn't disappointed.  Everyone will comment on how the restaurant operates, but what about the FOOD??  I was pleasantly surprised with the flavor and quality of everything from the salad bar to the roasted meats.  I thought maybe this place would be so focused on their 'unique' dining experience that the food would suffer - not the case!  A few things to note that might be helpful:  1. Lunch offerings are different than dinner.  Cheaper price but less options on salad bar as well as with meat options. 2. You can go to Costco and buy $100 gift cards for $79. 3. If you're paying with gift card - you CANNOT place a tip on your bill.  Cash only. 4  Go on their website and sign up for their email list a few days prior for a "$25 off dinner for two coupon". 5. You have the option to just purchase the salad bar at a much lower price, if that's your thing.  Will be going back soon to hit up the salad bar (I still have $30 left on my giftcard.)

ECeFR96aSXX6qwy9jd6Qmw.text: This was our first visit and I'm giving the food only 4 stars.  The salad bar was amazing and we had no problems with the quality of frequency of the meats offered.  However....we were greeted (and I use the term loosely) by the worst hostess I've ever encountered in a restaurant.  She didn't smile, spoke like a robot and acted like she was doing US a favor by leading us to first one table, then no.....another table......all without making eye contact or speaking. And this is the first impression of their restaurant!  She asked if we were celebrating anything (we were there for a birthday) but no complimentary dessert ever materialized.   There was confusion over who was supposed to be our server and one staff person snottily replied IT'S RIGHT THERE when asked the location of the restroom. Wow.  Do they really think the food is so good that they can get away with this attitude????

kFj25YVPqj0TKjqV_deYvw.text: This place exceeded my expectations! There were so many delicious meat options - steak, chicken, pork, lamb - and the "salad" bar was expansive. The only issue is that the meat doesn't come around fast enough, and when it does you only get one slice/piece. So you basically get one small piece of meat every few minutes.
